characters: A PRIVATE ESTATE IN THE HILLS -
A BACK ENTRANCE TO THE CHATEAU -
THE BACK LAWN OF THE CHATEAU -
IN A CORNER OF THE WAREHOUSE -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark, and so it takes us a minute to realize we're MOVING UP STONE SPIRALING STAIRS, up up up in what we now is a medieval cathedral.  And as we continue MOVING UP something TRICKLES DOWN INTO FRAME - BLOOD.  Running thin then thicker, as we CONTINUE TO MOVE UP the stairs and fi A BODY, sprawled awkwardly across the stones, arms and le akimbo, not so much Christ-like as victim-like.  In one h the Body holds a GUN he never had a chance to use.  In th other - A DARK SHAPE, we can't quite tell what it is. FOOTSTEPS sound from above and - THE KILLER walks into fr silenced pistol dangling at his side.  We don't know him, it's going to be a while before we see him again, but mar his face because we'll see him again.  The Killer now pic up the dark shape in the Body's hand, and we see it's - A BRIEFCASE.  The Killer cuffs the Briefcase to his wrist a turns to - TWO MEN standing behind him: subordinates.  Th Killer shows them the Briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God loves me. THE BODY suddenly twitches -- this guy is not quite dead. The Killer raises his silenced pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his victim)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't think he's too fond of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PHONE RINGS, replacing the sound of the silenced gun sh we expected to hear. Rain-slicked cobblestones gleam in a twinkling of streetlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The source of the ringing.  We start to PUSH SLOWLY IN on phone booth, and as we do we hear the VOICE of an UGLY AMERICAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOCCER MATCH is in progress on a TV which sits above th bar in this smokey, dim dive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not football... And now we're PULLING BACK DOWN THE LENGTH OF THE BAR.  W see THREE MEN sitting seperately at the bar, paying no attention to each other.  One of these men watches the ga with real interest.  The Ugly American talks on from off screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Football is three hundred pound guys, they run way too fucking fast, they got helmets made of kevlar they use to spear the quarterback into the next life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone is still ringing, louder now, and we're MOVING TOWARDS it while looking THROUGH AN UNSEEN PAIR OF EYES, even as we drink this in we're back in -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE END OF THE BAR - LARRY, the Ugly American.  He's g an obvious attitude, all of it bad.  But there's somethin about the guy -- he's not all bluster, and he has the loo a seasoned tough guy who knows how to get rough and tumbl He's big, and yeah he's got a gut, but the rest of him lo solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking to the air)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna know what football is?  It's hitting the other guy dirty and then spitting in his face when he's down. Football is all things American, and American is A-Number-One the absolute fucking best there is.  That's what football is... (he points to the TV)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And that's not football. The one man at the bar who's been watching the gam turns slowly and gives Larry a long look.  This is VINCENT: Fre hard boiled and solid.  Charming when he wants to be, whi isn't all that often.  He gives Larry a long look and the speaks -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Larry in perfect English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Football -- American football -- is a game for faggots. A BEAT.  The other two men at the bar, who seem like toug customers themselves, pretend not to watch too closely, b they're interested: what's Larry going to say?  For a mom it seems as if he's pissed, but then suddenly a smile bre out on his face and he laughs heartily at Vincent's remar Vincent joins in, as do the others.  In particular - THE BARTENDER looks relieved -- he's tough enough to toss a b drunk, but these guys are in a different league.  The Bartender laughs with the others, happy to have avoided a confrontation as we go back to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost ON TOP OF the phone booth, the phone is stil ringing as a HAND reaches INTO FRAME and snatches the pho from its cradle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a touch Irish accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? ANOTHER ANGLE - And we see a woman named DEIRDRE on the phone: striking, dark-haired, Irish.  She carries herself with the same professional edge as the men inside the bar Deirdre listens for a moment to the voice on the other en and before she speaks she sense something - A SILHOUETTE stands in the shadows of the bar, watching Deirdre.  She gives this silhouette a measure glance before speaking, h hand creeping ever so slightly towards her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you? The silhouette steps into a POOL OF LIGHT.  This is SAM. Tough, lean, enigmatic.  Somebody you might trust, but wh you'd never cross.  Sam returns her look before he speaks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Sam moves towards the bar, and Deirdre returns to her pho conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here... (a beat, responding to a question)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam enters and by now the men inside have all come togeth at the bar, talking casually, recognizing they're somehow here for a reason.  With Larry and Vincent we see - GREGO man from Eastern Europe.  His accent is hard to pin down, but he most definitely has one.  Gregor has the air of an spook, and that's exactly what he is.  Lastly we see SWED blonde, muscular, and somehow blank in the face.  No, he' not stupid -- he's a sociopath.  Now - Sam looks at the group, which grows quiet as he enters.  Finally, Sam spea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a challenge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think we're here to meet you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meeting Vincent's gaze)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else would you be? Vincent turns towards the others, including them in an expansive gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know cops -- and you're no cop. Vincent smiles at Sam's answer, satisfied, and makes room Sam to join them.  Vincent takes a pack of cigarettes, sh them so that one sticks out, and offers it to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. Vincent looks a little disappointed at this as we go -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PAY PHONE makes a sharp noise as it's cracked back in the cradle.  Deirdre stands at the phone booth, lost in thought.  Then, without warning - Deirdre spins around, pulling TWO GUNS from inside her coat.  The move is fast, performed with the grace of a professional killer, as Der scans the horizon, but nobody seems to be watching.  Deir pockets her guns and steps into the shadows of the street the better to watch - THE BAR - And as Deirdre watches the bar we watch her. PULLING BACK from Deirdre, UP INTO THE AIR and then MOVIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING THROUGH A WINDOW, donw onto the street below.  Ba visible we can see Deirdre.  And staring at Deirdre - THE WATCHER.  Somebody we're going to see periodically throug the movie.  Right now he's only a SILHOUETTE with a well- defined PAIR OF HANDS.  And in those hands - A KNIFE.  As Watcher watches he slowly cleans his nail with the knife, methodically, perfectly.  And he watches.  First Deirdre, then turning his attention to THE BAR.  He's especially interested in the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BARTENDER is wiping out a last glass.  When this is finished he looks up at -

dialogues.speaker: A TABLE IN THE BACK -
dialogues.text: Where our five guys have relocated.  Now the Bartender an Vincent exchange a look, and then the Bartender takes out set of keys and tosses them - THROUGH THE AIR and they SM into Vincent's hand.  The Bartender and Vincent speak in rapid-fire French, and then the Bartender is gone.  Sam t to Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trusts you to lock up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say he knows who I am. Vincent takes out his pack of cigarettes and offer them around the table -- again, nobody takes on.  Vincent seem really disappointed by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody wanna tell me what we're waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighting his cigarette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question isn't what we're waiting for... it's who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who the fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever hired us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got this gig through a contractor. And he most definitely didn't know who was doing the hiring, only that they were paying a lot of money... There's a kind of general look around the table -- a nod grunt of acknowledgement, indicating that all of these me were hired the same way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing his thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So none of us knows who's paying the freight, this is just some anonymous job. For all we know, we're working for different people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that is an interesting proposition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if there's more than one party involved, if we really are working for different people, then perhaps some of us are on different sides. (with great meaning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your orders might be different from mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about, man?  I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly, but loud enough to be heard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a surprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a surprise for you, blondie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply, as if he's used to giving orders)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't both of you shut up? LARRY & SWEDE (to Gregor at the same time)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off! There is a BEAT.  Gregor, Swede and Larry look at Sam, wh glares them all down.  Lastly, Sam turns and looks at Vincent.  The two men nod at one another, acknowledging a kind of mutual respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The point remains: we could be working for different people.  There's a chance for one of us... (looks around the table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe more than one of us -- has been paid to cross the others.  I don't know about you guys, but I like to know who I'm working for.  It can help prevent a great deal of... (finding the right word)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...unpleasantness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting the gun inside his cheap suit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody tries to unpleasant me I'll put two between his eyes -- one to do the job and the other to make sure it takes. From OFF SCREEN we hear a new sound: LAUGHTER.  ANOTHER A Deirdre has entered the bar, and she's amused by this las exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to see you've all got such faith in our little undertaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at Larry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name is Deirdre, and I'm running this show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?  IRA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a brittle laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not likely.  Once, yeah, I was -- but there wasn't an inch of profit in it, and I'm a cash oriented girl, if you take my meaning.  I'm a hired gun, same as the rest of you, and that's all any of us needs to know about the other. Deirdre hands out several thick envelopes.  Larry and Swe open theirs and stare at the wads of Franc Notes stuffed inside.  Even Gregor cracks his envelope and peaks at his money.  But neither Vincent nor Sam takes a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From here on in you want something you pay cash for it: no credit cards, no bank accounts are in place: ten percent up front, the rest when the job is done. (a quick beat, then she looks at Gregor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.  What do you do and what should we call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These days they they call me Gregor -- and I'm a tech.  I do electronic work, surveillance, computer runs. Deirdre turns to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam.  I'm a weapons guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were a soldier, were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once. Deirdre gives Sam a look -- and he returns it.  Finally, Deirdre turns to Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drive -- and my name is Larry.  Larry from the States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she turns to Vincent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Vincent.  And I coordinate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coordinate what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things.  This is my country, you know. The two men exchange another look.  A pecking order is developing among the group: Vincent and Sam are both natu leaders, and now they're feeling one another out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vincent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coordinate all you want, but make sure whatever you do gets cleared through me. (Vincent doesn't respond for a moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we in sync on this, Vincent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Deirdre waits a BEAT, letting Vincent know what she isn't more intimidated by him than he is by her.  Finally, she turns to Swede.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They call me Swede.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is it you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? (with a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAPER TARGET, in the shape of a human being, dances in place as it is riddles with GUNSHOTS, each shot hitting t target in the belly, each shot fired by - Larry, whose be shooting a sleek automatic pistol from which he's just discharged an entire clip.  The gun is empty, Larry turns Sam, who stands next in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the target)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shoot alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gets the job done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All in the stomach, though.  Your man might live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long enough to shoot back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been known to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a challenge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go do better, then... Without a word, Sam pops a new clip into the gun and SHOO THE LIGHTS out of several other human targets, hitting ea target in a different place.  One he clips between the ey the next in the heart, one in the groin, and then the las target - He SPLITS DOWN THE MIDDLE, firing shot after sho from the head to the groin until the target is sheared in half.  Larry is impressed in spite of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well...  My way works too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My way is better.

dialogues.speaker: IN A CORNER OF THE WAREHOUSE -
dialogues.text: Gregor has set up a table loaded with computers and electronic whizmos.  Right now Gregor is holding a particularly high-tech type CELL PHONE in his hands, look at it almost lovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it alright? ANOTHER ANGLE - Deirdre sits nearby, looking at the cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quite satifactory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, because it cost enough.  There's cheaper phones by far than that one, man: you better fucking use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost caressing the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I intend to.  This phone is wired like no other: it's got an encryption chip and instant sat-a-link recognition, it can talk to any computer in any language and make it understand.  With my custom hardware and this phone I can trace the target's cell phone signature and follow him anywhere he goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd stake my reputation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But would you stake your life, that's the question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this business, your life and your reputation are more often than not one and the same. From off screen we hear MUNCHING.  It's - Larry inhaling sandwich.  A malicious look comes over Swede's face, who' cleaning a pistol and sitting near Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should watch what you eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck died and appointed you food czar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just worried about your health, Larry.  You could stand to shed a few pounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensitive about his weight)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you could stand to get a little smarter, ain't that right you dumb blonde fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensitive about the dumb blonde thing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you calling dumb, dickless? Both men eyeball one another, and then suddenly Larry rea for his piece, and as soon as he does this Swede does the same thing, but before they can do anything - DEIRDRE'S G swings INTO FRAME, smashing Swede in the face and droppin him to the floor.  Larry's mouth drops open in surprise, it's too late: Deirdre kicks him in the stomach and then rabbit punches him in the back of the neck, driving him t the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing above them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next one of you fuckers plays this game I'm going to do for you myself.  I won't say it again: we don't have time for this shit!  There's a clock running on this job, gentlemen, and I mean to be on schedule. A TENSE MOMENT as Deirdre stares down at these tough guys letting them know who's in charge.  A SOUND from OFF SCRE interrupts this moment: a DOOR opening, as we see - Vince who stands in the door, wearing his coat and hat. He's been out somewhere, and he looks first at the squabb men, and then at - Deirdre.  She gives Vincent a little n a silent command that makes Vincent turn to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go for a ride. Vincent and Sam start off, moving towards the door, while and larry slowly pick themselves up off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To see a man about a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DESOLATE URBAN LANDSCAPE - Sam and Vincent walking away from the warehouse, which is housed in what looks to be t toughest neighborhood in the city, filled with CHEAP CONC PUBLIC HOUSING and INDUSTRIAL BUILDINGS. THE SETTING SUN throws a red glow on the street, giving t raw concrete buildings a blood-colored tint, as Sam and Vincent approach a FIAT, a car neither too old nor too ne Before they can reach the car, the two men are intercepte FOUR TOUGHS, young guys in their early twenties.  The LEA of the Toughs apporaches Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gave you permission to park here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vincent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much what you'd expect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a charge for parking on our block. The other Toughs add lib a few tough guy remarks (in Fren of course).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says this is their block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As in, they own it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I suppose he's saying that we oughta give them something for using it, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know that you spoke French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.  But the language he's speaking is universal. ANGLE ON THE LEADER - Who's smirking at Vincent and Sam. Sam's words make a great deal of sense: the Leader is speaking the universal language of "give me some money or I'll kick your ass."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we oughta give them something... CUT BACK TO: Vincent and Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think we should. Vincent backfists the Leader in the nose -- hitting him s hard that the Leader skitters back on unsteady feet and t sits down on his ass.  This blow hurt, but the real damag to the Leader's pride.  Now - One of the Toughs rushes at Sam, only to have Sam perform what looks like a jujitsu t which savagely jerks the Tough off his feet and flattens

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if it were an accident)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, I am sorry about that... (he sticks his hand out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you a hand. Sam reaches down as if to help the Tough, who ignores the hand and totters to his feet.  As soon as he's up he turn and runs away, followed by the other Toughs.  Now only th leader is left behind.  He looks for a second at Vincent Sam, and then turns and runs after his friends.  Vincent calls after him in French, but whatever he says isn't translated.  Vincent turns to unlock the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked if we could give him anything else. By now the two men are in the car, which starts up and dr off, as it does we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a nice move you did on our young friend.  Judo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jujitsu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.  Similar, but not the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One's a lot more painful than the other. Vincent laughs, and Sam looks out the window at the city Paris as we MOVE THROUGH to the outside world of -

dialogues.speaker: TWILIGHT
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF QUICK CUTS of the car driving through Paris a night.  We don't see familiar sights like the Eiffel Towe the Arc de Triomph, but instead - We travel through the L BANK, down a series of Mazy Alleys which twist and turn, filled with bistros, bars and falafel joints.  NEON SIGNS line the streets for as far as the eye can see.  Near the of this trip we hear the SOUND OF A MATCH FLARING, follow by -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I get one of those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent is driving and smoking a cigarette.  He tosses hi pack to Sam, but he seems a little surprised at Sam's request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help yourself. (quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when do you smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have, I don't know, maybe a cigarette a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cigarette?  As in one? (exasperated, almost to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One cigarette a week, who smokes like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, I smoke a pack-and-a-half a day, and I tell myself I could be worse. (takes a satisfying drag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just so damned pleasurable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing a smoke ring with great skill)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has it's moments. (stubs out cigarette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course, you get cancer and die, that's the down side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is that. Vincent stamps his cigarette out, looking vaguely unhappy that Sam has spoiled his smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Vincent: why bring me along for the ride?  Job like this calls for a warm body, somebody who can stand around and look threatening.  A tough guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Larry or Swede.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  Why not bring them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I thought the conversational possibilities were limited.  Of course, I might have brought Gregor, but he didn't seem like the right candidate -- for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch that one, he's an ex-spook for sure, maybe Stasi, maybe KGB.  He's smart, Gregor is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is the woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deirdre?  Smart, yeah, and seriously goddamned dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if she truly left the IRA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've wondered that myself.  None of this answers my question, though... (suddenly direct)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why bring me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to see who you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I? Vincent, driving all the while, gives Sam a sideways glan before speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were once some kind of special forces.  Airborne Ranger, maybe a Navy SEAL.  After that you rode shotgun for the CIA in some place like El Salvador or Afghanistan, a real mercenary. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only now -- now you're like the rest of us, it's a very competitive market since the end of the cold war.  There's a lot of hired guns out here, and not nearly enough work to go around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right: there's not hardly enough work these days, nothing that pays the big money, anyhow.  Then along comes this job, paying so much goddamned money I couldn't afford not to take it.  Somebody's paying through the nose for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They certainly are.  Whatever it is we're going to steal, it must be quite something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is it must be goddamned priceless. And on that thought we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fiat pulls up to the curb and Vincent and Sam get out Vincent leads Sam around a corner and they come to - AN EXQUISITE PARK, a small, perfectly manicured place -- kind of mini-Luxembourg Gardens in the middle of nowhere. When Sam sees the park, he draws an involuntary breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovely, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'd have to keep something like this under lock and key in New York, and it would still get fucked up. The two men enter the park, which is, indeed, open to the public.  Inside, sitting on a bench in the back, almost invisible from the street, we see - FRANCOIS, a stubble-f tough with a stained shirt and bad teeth.  Vincent and Sa draw near.  This next conversation between Francois and Vincent is in FRENCH WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good right where you are, Vincent. Vincent signals for Sam to stop.  Both Vincent and Sam ar still several feet away from Francois.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast. (nods slightly to Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if he recognizes Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad company...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a cop, Vincent, he's French and he's a cop and you better shoot him in the fucking head right now! Sam hasn't said a word -- he doesn't seem to understand what's been said, but he has noted the urgency with which Francois spoke.  Now - We HOLD FOR A BEAT.  Neither Vince nor Francois pulls out a piece to shoot Sam.  Instead the wait to see if Sam will respond in any way to what Franco said.  The conversation now switches to ENGLISH, which (i turns out) Francois speaks fairly well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vincent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to see something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (that edge creeping into his voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what? Vincent isn't going to answer, but the overbearing Franco chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted to see how you reacted when I said that you were a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he can't believe this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told him I was a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me to say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Vincent, truly pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked you to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to know a lot of shit, Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vincent, in subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready? Francois's French words give Sam pause -- he's wondering what's being said, as - Vincent moves towards Francois, leaving Sam several steps away.  The conversation is agai SUBTITLED FRENCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking out an envelope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been a slight problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (immediately tensing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Francois gives the slightest of nods, indicating that Vin should look towards a place perhaps thirty yards away - A COPSE OF TREES, where we see a SNIPER pointed a telesco rifle at Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still in subtitled French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say a word in English, Vincent, my friend with the high powered sporting rifle will shoot you in the throat. Sorry to screw you over like this, but the information you want might get me killed if I give it to you, and that's a price I'm not willing to pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take it you still want the money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English, with a grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. SAM'S POV: Looking at Vincent and Francois. The men are talking, and from here we can't really hear t speak.  All Sam can see is an earnest Vincent listening t Francois talk, almost as if Francois is giving Vincent instructions.  Now - Vincent reaches into his pocket, reaching for the envelope of cash he's carrying.  As he h the money to Francois, Vincent uses his free hand to pull his gun while - Sam already has his gun out -- somehow he figured out what was going on -- and now Francois looks o stunned disbelief as - Sam fires a single shot, hitting Francois in the shoulder driving him away from - Vincent, who now squeezes off sev rapid fire shots at the sniper, while - Francois, bleedin but still very much alive, now has his piece free just as The Sniper, his gun firing wildly into the air, falls to ground, shot dead by Vincent, and now - Francois is drawi bead on Vincent when - Sam hits Francois with a fusillade bullets in the chest and now - A SINGLE SPENT BULLED CASI flies through the air in SLOW MOTION and lands on the gro spinning around until it comes to a halt and - A HEAVY SILENCE FALLS, as the last echo of the last gunshot final dies.  Vincent and Sam look at one another, see that they still alive, and then look back at - The two men they've shot.  Francois isn't quite dead.  Blood bubbles from his lips as Vincent leans over him.  Again, they speak in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my information?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a grim smile, pointing to his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you better find it in your heart to tell me, Francois, because while your death is inevitable, it still isn't decided how painful it's going to be. A LONG ANGLE - Vincent whispers in Francois's ear, whose blanches as he realizes Vincent means to hurt him.  Franc whispers something back and then - BANG.  Vincent shoots Francois in the head, killing him instantly.  Then Vincen bends down and retrieves the envelope of money which Fran had tucked inside his shirt.  As Vincent does this, Sam c up from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now would be a good time to get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men drive in silence for a moment.  Vincent light cigarette and offers one to Sam, who refuses.  Finally, S speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, what you pulled back there, that was bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed to see if you were a cop. (defensively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a popular man with the police, Sam, and whenever they try to catch me they always do it with an inside guy -- some man on some job who seems more trustworthy than all the others put together.  And that's the guy you have to watch out for. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate cops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insulted that Vincent would even consider it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I ain't a cop. A BEAT, the two men driving in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That there was a gun pointed at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you look off when Francois nodded his head.  I figured he wasn't pointing out a particularly rare shrub, and the rest was easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how did you know I would have the presence of mind to pull my weapon when I did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if it's obvious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because that's what I would have done...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent's Fiat is parked at the curb in front of this apartment house.  Vincent and Sam exit the car and move towards the house -- a silence hanging between them.  Rig before they go into the house, Vincent takes out the enve full of cash that was supposed to have been for Francois. thinks for a moment and then hands the whole envelope to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saved my life back there in the park. I know this doesn't begin to make it right between us... Vincent's voice trails off -- he doesn't know what to say Sam takes the money out of the envelope -- half he keeps himself, the other he gives to Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I did back in the park I did because we're working together -- we're on the same team. (holding up the money)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is business -- this is work.  We did it together, we share the spoils, even split. Sam opens the door to the house, but Vincent has one last thing to say to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you a heavy debt. Sam almost smiles cynically at this: debts of honor don't seem to be something he believes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say. They enter the house and the door closes behind them.  A second later we hear -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do with the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent and Sam sit with Deirdre in a room, alone.  They' told her about the park, and she seems a little pissed ab all of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We kept it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hazard pay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with an exhalation of disgust)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of you were supposed to go to a simple meet and come back with a simple piece of information, and instead you went to fucking war...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't real thrilled about it either... Deirdre shakes her head in disgust and rises.  We FOLLOW

dialogues.speaker: AN ADJOINING ROOM -
dialogues.text: Where Larry, Swede and Gregor are waiting.  They look up expectantly at Deirdre, who crosses through the room with stopping -- she's really pissed about this turn of events

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely stopping, very snappish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deal?  The deal is we leave for Nice at first light. And she exits, leaving these three men behind along with and Vincent, who have entered from the other room.  larry looks at the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you guys do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAR sits, cloaked in shadows.  Inside sits our friend, WATCHER.  Once again we see the Watcher's knife -- once a he manicures his nails with it, almost delicately, as he watches the House.  It's dark -- a single light glows beh a window on the third floor.  Sam's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam has pushed all the furniture aside to make enough roo do a martial arts form.  Right now he's frozen, one leg extended in a kick, balancing on the other leg.  Now - A KNOCK at his door -- seconds later, it opens.  Deirdre st there, watching as Sam holds his position for a BEAT more and then retracts his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel as if I've wandered onto the set of Enter The Dragon.  Could you teach me to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think to see you again tonight. You were pretty pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Deirdre spings at Sam, throwing martial arts combinations him: punch followed by kick, elbow strike followed by pal thrust.  Sam parries her blows as she drives him across t floor until he's got his back to the wall.  Their movemen are controlled, but powerful, and there's something almos flirtatious about the whole thing.  Now - Deirdre throws one last punch which Sam ducks.  He slips behind her and suddenly they square off in earnest.  The previous martial arts stuff was a kind of choreographed exercise, but now - They spar for real -- they never hit another, but they come awfully close, hands and feet whiz through the air, throwing rapid-fire combinations and techniques.  They're not angry, but they're not kidding, either.  Finally - Deirdre feints a punch that distracts Sam's attention from - The KICK she throws right behind h punch, and she smiles as - WHUMP!  Sam wasn't distracted all -- he drops to the ground beneath her kick and catche her standing leg with a sweep which takes her to the grou and now - She's trapped beneath him.  The two of them are breathing hard from the exertion, their faces close to on another, shining with sweat and excitement and - We've go from flirting to an almost primal seduction, and with the faces only inches apart Deirdre leans in to kiss Sam, and he's about to meet her half way when he pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of me says I should just look at this as a perk.  You know, a bonus.  But then I remember you're you -- Deirdre who used to belong to the IRA -- and it occurs to me that deceit and subterfuge come very naturally to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing him very lightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's saying they don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returning the kiss, just as lightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when I consider that, I have to wonder if you don't have some ulterior motive for being here, with me, right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I probably do. (pulling him close)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But for the time being, I'm willing to forget about it... They finally kiss, slowly and then building in intensity, as they start to make love the CAMERA MOVES UP - THROUGH THE BUILDING, floor by floor, u we've reached -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deirdre and Sam are not the only ones indulging in extracurricular activities.  Up here in this rooftop gard we find Swede and Gregor talking in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would imagine that the great satisfaction in all of this will be killing the American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (we know this isn't true)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hadn't thought about it.  Understand me, Gregor -- I take no pleasure in killing.  It doesn't bother me one bit, but I don't get off on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A means to an end, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he rises to leave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess we're set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one other thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Suddenly Swede pulls Gregor down to the rooftop with a ha THUD.  Within seconds he has his gun pressed to Gregor's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cross me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's going to do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (truly frightened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you, Swede, I can't do this without you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then he puts his gun away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to make sure you knew who you were dealing with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, I do... Swede is now on his feet, walking away, back into the apartment house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (this is almost to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember it, then. And he's gone.  And as soon as he is, we notice something strange about Gregor: he's not the least bit scared -- he laughs a little low laugh as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAY LIGHT seeps in from the horizon, while inside in -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deirdre is pulling her dress over her head.  Sam seems to sleeping in his bed as she moves like a cat towards the d when - Sam's HAND reaches out, gently yet firmly, and takes her the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No goodbye? ANOTHER ANGLE - Sam is somehow sitting up, wide awake -- looking at Deirdre with a penetrating glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Sam, don't take it the wrong way when I tell you we won't be doing this again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to explain yourself to me, Deirdre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost surprised by this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I don't have to, Sam, it's just that, for once, I want to.  when I was a - (almost with a sneer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patriot, it was a given I'd sleep with any man it was deemed necessary for me to sleep with.  You know: any man who needed setting up.  Sometimes so we might blackmail him, sometimes so he could be killed. (a quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes so I could kill him myself. IRA isn't exactly an enlightened feminist organization, Sam.  To most of the men I with I was always the girl.  "Send the girl to do it."  "Tell The girl to take care of it."  "Have the girl fuck him." (a quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I look at you and I get this feeling you take me for what I am: no more, no less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a hired gun, Deirdre -- just like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  And last night I wanted to be with someone who was just like me. Somewhere in all of this Deirdre has sat back down on the bed, and somehow now she's only inches away from Sam. They're lips brush and - A MUTED PHONE RINGS in a nearby room, breaking the moment QUICK BEAT, then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better be getting that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duty calls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a trace of a sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just business. Deirdre gives Sam a light kiss on the lips and then she o his door.  The muted phone is a little louder now.  Deird closes Sam's door as she exits, but - Sam reaches out a h and catches the door right before it snaps shut.  He watc THROUGH THE DOOR CRACK as - Deirdre cross the hall and opens the door to her room, and now the phone rings loudl until the door shuts, muting the sound once again, shutti Sam out.  The phone stops ringing as Deirdre answers and this happens Sam shuts his door and as the door closes we to - BLACK.  Just for a second.  And then - BLINDING SUN us in the eyes as we find ourselves above -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DAZZLING OVERHEAD MOVING SHOT, establishing that we've changed locales, moved to a place filled with sun and blu water and reflective surfaces: the Cote d'Azure.  We star

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TOPLESS GRANDMA reclines on a beach chair, soaking up r sipping a drinnk just delivered by a young stud of a WAIT Nearby -

dialogues.speaker: AT A ROUND TABLE -
dialogues.text: A nice distance from anyone who might try to listen in, w find our group: Deirdre, Sam, Vincent, Gregor, Swede, and Larry.  Food and drink surround them.  Larry is, of couse still eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now then, let's run through it one more time, shall we? (to Gregor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I use my cell phone to get computer access to the telecommunications satellite used by our target.  I trace his cell phone signature and use it to pin point his location as he moves through Nice, relaying that information to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Larry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sigh, he's done this too many times)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call me with the target's route, I follow along until we've reached the attack point and then I run his squag ass off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Swede)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which leads us to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ride with fat-boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat shit and die slowly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After we stop the target car I get out and use the heavy artillery to kill the driver and his bodyguard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I blast the lead car into oblivion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Sam and I take out the back two cars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking it up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Leaving me to step in, drop the target in the back seat, and get the package...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a quick look at Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returning her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...While I back him up, making sure to get the package if something goes wrong and somebody takes Swede down. Nobody else seems to notice this look between them, but w should -- if only to note that there's something about th way Deirdre queries Sam about his role, and something abo the way Sam answers her without overly reacting -- they'r not flirting, but there's a kind of acknowledgment of the history they now have between them.  But -- nobody else notices, and Swede's line follows Sam's without breaking flow of the dialogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's taking me anywhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Swede and I split with the package and meet you back at the rendezvous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Sam, you and I clean up whatever's left to be cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good.  Now all we have to do is live long enough to get paid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ROW OF ROOMS, each one with a light behind a shade.  Ev as we watch the light in each room goes off: one two thre four five six lights -- one for each member of the team. night before the big event nobody breaks curfew.

dialogues.speaker: A BAR -
dialogues.text: Through the bar window we see the Watcher's silhouette. match flares as the Watcher lights a cigarette, REVEALING face for the first time: weathered, sharp, treacherous. MATCH goes out, and the Watcher's face FADES TO BLACK, an do we.

dialogues.speaker: A PRIVATE ESTATE IN THE HILLS -
dialogues.text: A CARAVAN OF BLACK ARMOR PLATED CARS, all idling, ready t pull out, filled with muscular men in suits with bluges u their jackets, all of them waiting for - THE TARGET.  Exc we've seem him before and he wasn't called the Target: he the Killer from the first scene of the film: the gunman i the cathedral who made off with -  THE BRIEFCASE.  Which briefcase is still handcuffed to his side.  Now the Targe gets into his car, a BLACK MERCEDES, and as soon as he's the caravan pulls out and - The Target takes out his cell phone, punches in a number and starts to talk, and as he we - PULL BACK, INTO THE AIR, leaving the Caravan behind we MOVE TOWARDS THE WATER and - THE PROMENADE DES ANGLAIS, the long roadway that runs the length of the town adjacent to the beach.  It's a special place, a huge road for cars, along with a promenade for tourists.  Here we come upon -

dialogues.speaker: AN OUTDOOR CAFE -
dialogues.text: Where we find Deirdre, a laptop in front of her, wearing HEADSET.  And, lest we think she looks out of place, we g a look at -

dialogues.speaker: THE REST OF THE CAFE -
dialogues.text: Where many of the other PATRONS are typing away on laptop or chattering like crazy on their cell phone.  She types sentence on her keyboard, and as she types she says it ou loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Gregor, I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing her sentence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready when you are... Gregor is sitting behind a console, looking at Deirdre's message, which we can read on his laptop.  Gregor also ha much bigger COMPUTER with him as well, and on this screen see - A COMPUTER GRAPHIC MAP OF NICE.  This is a map of incredible detail, a high-tech graphic rendering of Nice. Now - THE MAP starts to shift, randomly moving about the as it searches for the proper signal.  The computer isola an entire district of the city, enlarges a part of the district, and then locates and enlarges a single street. - On screen a FLASHING CURSOR appears on the map, the TAR The Cursor starts to move down one of the streets of Nice as we follow the Curson it TURNS INTO - THE TARGET CAR, driving home the point that Gregor is now locked onto the Target.  THE JAPANESE DRUMS we heard in the opening seque start to play again -- softly, ominously, and we're on -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where VINCENT'S FIAT is parked at a curb, Sam and Vincent sitting inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent sits behind the wheel, while Sam sits next to him loading a small arsenal of weapons. The DRUMS grow, a little louder now, a little more urgent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOLVO idles, waiting for something, Larry behind the wh of this car, and sitting next to him Swede.  The DRUMS continue to play, and their volume is still low, but they jarring, setting our nerves on edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is this broad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should learn a little patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's consider a virtue in some corners of the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in mine. THE CAR PHONE rings, and Swede pushes a button.  Deirdre' Voice is heard on the speaker phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello gentlemen, are we ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deirdre looks at her laptop and relays Gregor's instructi She speaks over her headset as if she's conducting ordina business -- as if she's giving someone traffic directs over the phone.  The JAPANESE DRUMS continue, quiet and y intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to take a left, then, so that you're going west. During this next sequence, the DRUMS will continue to pla building with the action as we do -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Volvo takes a flying left turn - Gregor watches the Target on his computer as it moves tow the Promenade des Anglais, typing the results on his keyboard as - The Volvo careens down a steep hill, hits a bump, and flies through the air a good fifteen feet, even The Fiat follows close behind and hits the same bump, doe the same flight through the air and lands with a thud - THE CARAVAN of cars -

dialogues.speaker: THE TARGET CAR -
dialogues.text: THE TARGET, still talking away on his cell phone - THE COMPUTER MAP tracking the Target's movements, as the Map shifts and moves as it keeps pace with the target, and no The Promenade des Anglais is right ahead and the DRUMS bu to a crescendo as - The Volvo SMASHES into the Target Car and they grind together, as - CARS 3 & 4 in the Caravan are cut off by Vincent's Fi which forces them to slam to a halt, as - Larry runs the Target Car to a halt and the JAPANESE DRUM stop. Larry and Swede hop out of the Volvo, and Swede brandishe MONSTER of a MACHINE GUN, with which he opens fire, a bla of huge guage shells spitting a trail of fire, smashing against THE WINDSHIELD of the Target Car, which is bullet proof.  The windshield doesn't break right away -- but th heavy blast of firepower causes the windsield to buckle. Sam and Vincent are now out of the Fiat, guns drawn, blaz away at BODYGUARDS, and Christ, there's an army of them, pouring out of Cars 3 & 4.  These guys are armed and fire as - Larry gets out of the driver's seat of the Volvo, and he' got some kind of sumbitch weapons himself, a ROCKET LAUNC which he points and fires - And now we TRACK THE MISSLE a it scorches the air, traveling towards - The LEAD CAR of the caravan which has only now realized what's going on behind it, and as frantic Bodyguards driv back towards the carnage - The Missle IMPACTS, blowing th Car sideways. Meanwhile - Sam and Vincent are taking out the Other Bodyguards, and these guys are warriors -- they moves as team, each man with a gun in both hands, using a weapon u it's out of bullets and then discarding it in favor of a one. And even as this is going on - Deirdre has joined the fra firing both of her pistols, taking Sam's place at Vincent side so that Sam can run towards - The Target Car, where the Target is seated in the backsea pulling out his own piece, ready to fight to the death himself as - Swede continues blasting away at the windshield with his monster gun, and now - The Windshield has started to crac and splinter, and abruptly, it shatters, instantly bursti bright red as Swede's bullets tear up the body of the Dri Now Sam has reaches the Target Car, just as the Target, w is armed and, as we know, not exactly helpless, steps out the car and sights in on Swede and - ZING!  Sam fires, winging the Target, knocking the gun out of his hand and still the Target won't give up without a struggle, he hit Swede with the Briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today. BANG.  Swede puts one shot between the Target's eyes, end his life.  Now - Swede takes out a DAI-SHO, the smaller o two traditional Japanese Samurai swords.  With one slashi blow he hacks off the Target's HAND AT THE WRIST and grab the briefcase.  The SEVERED HAND is still caught in the handcuffs, so that it is carried along for the ride.  Now DISTANT SIRENS sound from OFF SCREEN as Swede moves back towards Larry and the Volvo, and as he goes he raises the briefcase (with its severed hand) in a kind of mock salut Sam, who starts to move back towards Deirdre and Vincent, have taken care of the remaining Bodyguards, and now the SIRENS are growing closer as we - START TO MOVE IN SLOW MOTION as Swede approaches the Volvo and - Deirdre and Vi are already at Vincent's Fiat, waiting for Sam, and so th don't notice that - A VAN has been parked nearby this ent time, and now the van's side door slides open, and unseen any of the others - Gregor steps out of the Van, a gun at side, and a predatory look on his face as - Swede reaches and the Volvo just as - Sam has reaches the Fiat, and now back and sees - Gregor, crossing the street, and now - Sa screams a warning to Larry, but it's way too late because Swede shoots Larry in the neck, hitting him above the protective covering of his bullet proof vest.  Now we're MOVING IN REAL TIME as - Larry manages to get his backup piece drawn, a snub-nosed .38, and he fires all six shots into - Swede, hitting him in the stomach -- it's the same Larry shot the target in the warehouse.  Swede is sent fl backwards, where he crashes to the pavement.  For a secon think he's dead, but then he gets up, in pain but alive, as Sam predicted.  Swede claws at his shirt to reveal tha too wears a bullet proof vest.  By now - Larry has rolled of the Volvo, crawling away but too weak to go far, and n Swede has Larry in his sights, he's going to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't particularly like killing, tubby, but I want you to know that this one I'm going to enjoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees something over Swede's shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Swede turns to follow Larry's gaze, and as he does - Greg walks INTO FRAME and puts his gun right beneath Swede's c Before Swede can even compute this, Gregor pulls the trig firing straight up into Swede's brain.  Then, without eve looking at Larry, who is lying helpless on the ground - Gregor takes the briefcase and gets into the Volvo, drivi off just as - Sam arrives, kneeling down by Larry.  The S get louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in shock)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just...I don't believe that son-of- a... Vincent's Fiat comes peeling to a halt in front of them, Vincent and Deirdre inside it as Sam manages to get Larry into the back seat.  Sam doesn't get in the car yet as La says -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still having trouble believing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been crossed... The SIRENS reach a crescendo as a group of GENDARMES arri charging with automatic weapons drawn.  Between the Frenc cops and our heroes lies the shot up wreck of the Target and now - Sam takes out a GRENADE, pulls the pin, and rol it across the ground, beneath the Mercedes, which the cop have just reached.  Seconds later - The Car EXPLODES, cut off the cops, and as this happens, Vincents puts the peda the floor and gets the fuck out of Dodge.  We start to SL PULL BACK on the remains of this battle: the dead bodies, shot up cars, the broken glass, and that flaming, smoking hulk of a Mercedes in the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIREBALL of the car turns into a BLOOD RED SUN as it in the Western sky, tinting the stone buildings of the Ol City a coppery red. We're MOVING THROUGH the Old City, through the twists and turns of what an American would call back alleys but that pass for streets in this place.  It is quiet almost deser then - A TESTOSTERONE CRAZED PLAYBOY whips his sports car through one of these streets, engine whining, as we - MOV DOWN yet another side street, and this sucker really is a back alley, you couldn't get a car down here if you tried Finally, we come to - A RAT TRAP OF AN OLD BUILDING, and PUSH TIGHT on this building as we hear -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SYRINGE is plunged into Larry's arm.  Sam is tending to Larry's wound.  Sam seems to know what he's doing, as Lar is also hooked up to a bottle of plasma hanging on a make shift stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering Larry's question)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cocktail.  Mostly demerol, cut with a little crank because we might need you awake in the real near future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine with fucking me, we got work to do. I don't care what it takes, we are getting our property back and putting it into the hands of the people who are gonna pay us a great deal of money when we do.  I don't know about the rest of you guys, but I'm not the kind of guy to just sit back and take it in the ass. (a quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean that in, like, a literal way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finding this package is a thing easier said than done.  We don't even know what it is. (he looks at Deirdre, and suddenly he's deadly earnest)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did we steal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When this whole thing started you made it clear: you're running the show.  And I don't believe you'd be running this show if you didn't know what was going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't believe you... Vincent's gun is out in the blink of an eye, at Deirdre's head, but she's as fast as he is and her gun is drawn as well, jammed into his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly feral)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go shoot me if you want, Vincent, but you'll be dead before I hit the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matching her intensity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you dead, woman, I want the the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a dead cool in his voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both of you... ANOTHER ANGLE - Sam has the two of them covered with his an interesting moment, because he can shoot either Deirdr Vincent, but not both at the same time.  The question is: whose side is he on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing without missing a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...put your guns down and chill out. A BEAT.  And then Vincent and Deirdre lower their weapons followed by Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it or now, we're on the same side: we're here and the package isn't. (looks at Deirdre)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the boss any more, you're our partner.  So tell us what you know, so we can figure a way out of this mess. Sam's look isn't romantic, but it implies a level of trus based upon their physical intimacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, what did we steal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she hates to admit this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... (defensively, off Vincent's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I don't!  It's a goddamned mystery to me just like it is to you. (quick beat, then reluctantly continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do know who we're working for.  My people, and the Russian mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your people?  Who the fuck is your people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think, Larry?  The IRA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you believed me? (passionately)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it wasn't my people who did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if they had she'd be gone along with the package, instead of sitting here with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  Gregor, he was the Russian's man.  It was my people came up with the idea for this run, but the Russians who had the capital to finance it.  Gregor, he was their insurance, and I was ours. Everybody else was supposed to be neutral.  Gregor must've got to Swede...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never did trust that blonde fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you were riding with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question still remains: what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he figures something out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor's cell phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do, call him up and ask him to give us back our shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Larry, to Deirdre)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he bring that with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought it for him -- all the stuff he was using, it was in his contract.  Cost a nice penny, too, especially that goddamned phone: Gregor had expensive tastes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out. (he's thinking on his feet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor's a spook, or he was one until recently.  When he was a spy he lived the life -- you know, a prince in some Eastern Bloc country where nobody had shit and Gregor had everything.  Then the wall goes down.  No more Cold War.  And Gregor is out of a job.  No apartment, no special stores with Western food and video tapes.  I would bet dollars against shit that Gregor liked that phone and he doesn't want to give it up.  And I wouldn't be surprised if he's arrogant enough to think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing his sentence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That we're too stupid to trace his calls. Deirdre and Sam share the slightest of conspiratorial smi as they realize they're both thinking the same thought: t might still win this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on perhaps the MOST BEAUTIFUL STREET in all of Fran the Cours Mirabeau in the town of Aix. Outdoor cafes line the sides of the street, while a canop interlocking trees covers everything.  Now we're - MOVING DOWN THE STREET, towards a CAFE, where a DAPPER GENT sits sipping a mineral water.  The Gent has a SATCHEL at his f Now - A JEEP pulls up to a nearby corner and idles in neutral.  The Dapper Gent throws some bills on the table gets up, crossing to - The Jeep.  A door opens, and the Dapper Gent, carrying his satchel, gets into the jeep, wh drives off as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor and the Dapper Gent drive in silence for minute, d the length of the Cours Mirabeau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking the silence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful street, no? The Dapper Gent also has an accent, a much thicker one th Gregor's; it's an accent that places the Gent as a reside of what used to be called the Soviet Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he can't wait any longer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always in a rush, you are.  All these years I've known you, you could never wait for anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it is. Gregor, still driving, takes out a SILENCED PISTOL, and t Dapper Gent reaches for his own piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax! The Dapper Gent loweres his hand, leaving his gun in his Gregor pulls the van to a curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look over there. GREGOR & THE GENT'S POV: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD - A G CHILDREN are playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see that one?  The girl in the light blue dress? We find one particular LITTLE GIRL, around eight, holding end of a jump rope, wearing a light blue dress.  She's breathtakingly beautiful, and now - Gregor raises his silenced pistol, as if to shoot her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, have you lost your mind?!? Gregor pulls the trigger, as he does so the Dapper Gent j his arm, and we hear the soft thwpfft of the silenced sho just as the shot goes off - Missing its mark, harmlessly shooting into a tree, causing a SINGLE LEAF to float to t ground behind the playing children.  Nobody notices a thi BEAT.  The Dapper Gent is visibly shaken, because there i doubt that Gregor would have killed the Girl if the Gent hadn't ruined his aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To make a point.  I don't know her, and I was ready to splatter her brains all over the sidewalk. (giving the Gent a look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't particularly like you, so imagine what I'll do if you try anything... Gregor leaves his gun dangling in the air a moment longer necessary and then starts the jeep as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FULL MOON casts a silver light over a field of wild gra A soft wind blows, and the grass moves gently from side t side.  Now - Gregor's JEEP glides down this road as we MO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squirming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough!  We've been driving for an hour, where is my package? Gregor smiles -- he's been waiting for this.  He pulls th jeep over and looks at the Dapper Gent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's under your seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As my American friend Larry would say: are you fucking deaf?  It's under your seat. The Dapper Gent looks down, and sure enough, the edge of Briefcase sticks out beneath the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you'd do that, Gregor.  I thought I trained you better than that. With a laugh the Dapper Gent hands his satchel to Gregor, whose eyes literally dance with the prospect of his rewar He can't help himself, he opens the satchel and there it COLD HARD CASH in large bills, enough for Gregor to live a prince for quite some time.  Gregor sucks in an involun breath and then looks back up to see - The Dapper Gent ha reached for the Briefcase.  Instead he's taken out his gu and it's only inches from Gregor's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never particularly liked you either, Gregor. The Dapper Gent yanks out the Briefcase, and as he does - THE SEVERED HAND comes whipping out along with it, still attached by the handcuff chain.  The Hand flies up in the Dapper Gent's face, and we notice that the Hand is starti to rot -- it's bloated and swelling and horrific and it scares the shit out of the Dapper Gent, who drops his gun fumbles with the Briefcase as - THWPFFT...we hear the sou of another silenced shot as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DARK STAIN splashes against the passenger side window o the jeep.  Seconds later - The door swings open, and the Dapper Gent's body plunks out onto the ground.  A moment later, something wet and viscous plops down on the face o the Gent as the jeep drives off.  Now - We HOLD FOR A BEA the Dapper Gent's dead body, which lies in the silver moonlight, blood running out from beneath him, while the Severed Hand palms the Gent's face, fingers splayed out around his head.  Now - We HEAR the sound of PHONE TONES. And not just any phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor finishes punching a number into his CELL PHONE.  W hear a single ring on the other end of the phone before i picked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, English subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done. BEAT.  The Phone Voice doesn't respond for a moment -- wh this is they didn't expect to hear from Gregor.  The Voic switches to English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor, is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a low chuckle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much to your disappointment, no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a mistake, it shouldn't have happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly cold, furious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the middle of saving you people a great deal of money -- the least you could do is have the decency to pay me! BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I do is none of your concern.  What you should do is wait for my next phone call.  I'm going to find a place where I can tilt the field in my favor.  When I'm ready, I'll call you and tell you what I want you to do. The Phone Voice says something unintelligible in Russian, off by Gregor as he angrily snaps off his cell phone and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry snores on the couch, while Deirdre sleeps in a slee bag on the floor.  Vincent sits in a ratty easy chair, fe propped on an overturned crate, dozing lightly.  Suddenly Vincent's eyes open, warily, as if something has changed the room.  He looks around - No Sam.  Vincent gets up, ta out his gun, and silently gets to his feet.  He moves dow long hall and - No Sam.  Now, like a cat, Vincent moves i THE BATHROOM: pitch black.  He moves in, swipes the strin the overhead light and - nothing.  Nobody's here.  The on place left is the front door, and now Vincent approaches. opens the door, gun still at ready, and moves out into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a small building.  There is no other apartment on the floor.  At the far end of the landing, there is a sma ladder which leads up to - THE ROOF.  And the door which leads to the roof is flappi in a light wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent bursts onto the roof, gun straight out, finger on trigger, only to find - Sam is there, his gun pointed at Vincent.  A BEAT, then both men give little laughs and pu their weapons away, like Samurai so trained in combat tha they know when it's safe to relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't around when I woke up, I thought maybe something had happened. (off Sam's look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been one very fucked up job, Sam, and I'm not taking any more chances on anybody... (a quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Including you... In answer Sam takes out Vincent's pack of cigarettes and tosses them back to him.  Vincent looks almost delighted this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came up here to sneak a smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you don't mind I took your pack. It was on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very sincere, offering the pack)
