dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, help yourself.  Smoke as many you'd like. Sam considers for a minute, and then takes one.  Vincent so as well, and he searches for his lighter, which he can seem to find, because - Sam has it, and he lights their cigarettes, and then hands the lighter back to Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a shrug of the shoulders)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I borrowed that, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puffing contentedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course...whenever you feel like it just help yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a feeling I'm about to start buying my own. BEAT.  The two men smoke in silence, looking out at -

dialogues.speaker: THE CURVED SHORELINE OF NICE -
dialogues.text: Which glitters with thousands of lights from the apartmen buildings, and a thousand more from the cars that travel the road that leads into town: the Promenade des Anglais.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a bad bit of business, today. BACK ON Sam and Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen a lot of people die before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't.  Not like that.  How do you get used to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't.  You just learn to live with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't lie -- there have been times when I had to do it, times when the only way to get out alive was to see that the other man didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We live in a singular world, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never really thought I was part of the world you move in, Sam, to tell you the truth. (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a hood, a thief.  Big time in a small time king of way.  To the local police I'm a prize, to the local hoods I'm a legend.  But to a guy like you I'm just another two bit hired gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might be a hired gun, Vincent, but I got a feeling you cost more than two bits. This conversation might have gone further, but it is interrupted when Deirdre pokes her head up onto the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, I was starting to think that the two of you had thrown it in and walked away. (to Vincent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's someone on the phone downstairs asking for you, and my somewhat limited French leads me to believe that he might have something to tell us about Gregor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car we haven't seen before, a CITROEN, hums up the Fren highway in the night, along on the road.  It's a postcard moment, but only for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I could be dead and I'd drive better than you. Deirdre is driving, and Larry -- much to his chagrin -- i the passenger seat, watching her every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very curt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shut up...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK SEAT -
dialogues.text: Sam and Vincent have a MAP spread out.  Vincent is tracin Gregor's route so far, and we follow his RED MAGIC MARKER it traces a line up the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going north. (circles something on map)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Aix en Provence, where he used the phone. Sam runs his finger along the length of the highway on th map.  Destination: Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making up his mind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessarily.  He could go off road at any number of places.  He might not even be in the country anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Paris.  The route's too indirect for anything else.  A guy like Gregor, he doesn't waste time on this road unless he has to be on it in the first place. Otherwise, he'd be out of the country by now.  He's going to Paris. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I just hope we can find him before he gets there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If somebody else doesn't find him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orange, pronounced "Au-Ronge", is a mid-sized town of fif thousand souls.  It is small, charming, quaint, and it ha one particular thing that no other town in France can cla AN ANCIENT ROMAN THEATER that has been painstakingly restored.  We see this Roman Theater from the outside, as MOVE THROUGH the streets of the town, to the TOWN SQUARE. It's packed -- every seat in every outdoor cafe is filled with a tourist having breakfast.  This normally quiet pla explodes one month out of the year, when an international famous music festival is held in the Roman Theater.  We c upon - A TABLE OF AMERICAN TOURISTS: a Family.  Dad is angry at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opera?  This is an opera festival?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you that, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you meant Phantom of the Opera. You know, Andrew Lloyd Weber, Cats, that kind of thing. Mom and Dad continue their discussion, but we've left the behind, MOVING THROUGH the seats and cafes until we get t cafe on the outskirts of the Town Square.  Here, in the m removed table in the entire Square, we find Gregor sittin the shadow of the trellis.  Unless you're on top of him y can't see him, but he can see everything perfectly.  His phone sits on the table in front of him -- he picks it up starts to punch in a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CITROEN is parked among a number of other cars.  Sam sleeping in the back seat, while Vincent is seen on an outdoor pay phone at the other end of the parking lot. Deirdre and Larry sit at a nearby picnic table, eating Fr fast food, which we get a good look at as we - PAN THE LE OF THE TABLE, which is covered with pasta, grilled sausag with dijon mustard, really good fried potatoes. In fact, everything that's on this table is so far beyond imagination of your average American truck driver that La can't contain himself.  He's stuffing himself, washing everything down with the wine which is also sold at these road-side rest stops.  Deirdre drinks coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This...this is incredible. Is the rest of Europe like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some places, not all.  Italy, for instance, they're serious about their food.  But try bloody Britain, anywhere in the U.K., you don't get much fancier than a deep-fried bar egg.  Food's not our thing, you see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (everybody knows this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best beer in the world known to man or God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a snort)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Best beer in the world?  Budweiser for me, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with unconcealed scorn)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Budweiser?  You talk to me of beer and you've the unbridled gall to mention Budweiser in the same sentence?  That's not beer!  Christ, it's not even a poor excuse for rabbit piss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?  Whatta you drink, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I drink what every civilized man, woman and child in the world drinks: Guinness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to interrupt a conversation of such cultural depth... CUT AWAY TO REVEAL: Vincent - Who has finished his phone call and returned to join them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but we've got to get back on the road. Vincent raps lightly on the car window next to Sam's head Sam's eyes shoot open: a light sleeper.  All eyes are on Vincent, who waits for a BEAT before he reveals his news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor is seated where we saw him last -- at the little t in the corner cafe.  He's been here for hours, observing Town Square, and now, he finally sees what he's been look for - TWO MEN, definitely not tourists here for the music have entered the Square -- everything about these guys screams GUNMEN.  Now, as Gregor watches - A PUNKED-OUT TE comes up to the men and hands them a small envelope.  The Gunmen look around the Square, trying to see where Gregor but he's too far back in the shadows.  The Gunmen ask the Teen a question, to which the Teen can only shrug his shoulders.  Now - The Teen walks away, leaving the Gunmen open the envelope and look at its contents, which are qui read.  From OFF SCREEN we hear the sound of Gregor punchi in a number on his cell phone.  Simultaneously, the Gunme finish reading the instructions Gregor has sent them, and turn around to face - A PAY PHONE.  The phone rings, and of the Gunmen goes to pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Citroen pulls into town and slows to a crawl, cruisin the streets, looking for Gregor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent stares out of the window and sees something that causes him to swear under his breath in French.  It's - The Gunmen walking down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know those men. Sam frowns: he also seems to recognize at least one of th gunmen.  None of the others in the car notice Sam's react but we do.  The Gunmen are heading straight for -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE MID-AFTERNOON SUN shines down on the open air Roman Theater.  The theater itself is almost two thousand year old.  A semi-circle of seats surrounds a huge Stage Wall, massive structure which is one of the best preserved of i kind in the world.  THE GUNMEN enter at the bottom of the theater, holding ticket stubs.  They are with a Tour Grou led by an ANCIENT GEEZER who speaks in rapid-fire French. the tour moves off to see the Stage Wall, the Gunmen hang back and then separate from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CITROEN sits at a curb.  Larry sits behind the wheel the car, the getaway driver with the motor running.  Vinc and Deirdre are already walking towards the Theater.  Sam stays behind for a second to say something to Larry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you hear, whatever happens, when your partners come back out, you make sure you're here with the motor running. And on that note Sam follows after Vincent and Deirdre. Larry doesn't notice it, but - THE WATCHER has found them He's a block or so away, wearing a two-day stubble of bea and hugging the shadows of back alley.  Cradled in one ha barely visible but ominously present: his knife, which fo one moment catches a glint of sun that hits our eyes as w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gunmen have reached a point about midway up the colis like staircase.  Behind them we can see the Tour Group, standing on the stage, being lectured to by the Ancient Geezer.  In front of them the Gunmen find - AN EXIT which leads to an interior hall.  Inside the exit it's dark, while a bright sun falls down on the Gunmen. look into the dark, unable to see a thing, while a voice come at them from out of the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, gentleman, that will do nicely.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALL -
dialogues.text: ON GREGOR.  It's dark in here.  There are no lights, no torches.  From the dark in here, he can look out and see THE GUNMEN, who make plain targets, backlit as they are b the sun.  Now we CUT BACK AND FORTH between these two ANG and it becomes clear that Gregor has chosen wisely -- he see his quarry, but they can't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edvard, is that you? EDVARD, the more dangerous looking of the two Gunmen responds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Gregor, they sent me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm touched, really, that they'd send someone of your caliber.  It's nice to know that they didn't make the mistake of underestimating me twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a mistake, trying to kill you. Mikhi did it without consulting me, I'd have never allowed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.  But I'm sorry to say that it's too late for trust: we have a serious problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll double your price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now that's interesting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Do you have the money with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the material?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You first, Edvard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we could both go at the same time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a short laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think not. (with a flourish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you... A GUN COMES INTO FRAME, trigger cocked, the barrel placed Gregor's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you, asshole. Gregor stiffens, as we PULL BACK ON Sam, who has snuck up Gregor and gotten the drop on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might have been one mean technical spook, Gregor, but you wouldn't have lasted a week in the field. CUT TO THE GUNMEN'S POV: Looking into the Tunnel - It's d they can't see a thing, but they've heard Sam's voice and they know something's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor, are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregor's fine... CUT AWAY TO REVEAL: Deirdre - She's snuck up on the Gunmen, weapon drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I think you're in a bit of trouble. The Gunmen reach for their pieces and as they do -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even think it. CUT AWAY TO REVEAL: Vincent - And his piece is also out - the Gunmen are trapped, and they know it.  Now we notice - The Ancient Geezer and his Tour Group are coming toward us.  Meanwhile, back in -

dialogues.speaker: THE TUNNEL -
dialogues.text: Sam is grilling Gregor furiously, his gun still to Gregor head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to me unless you tell me what I want to hear, understand?!?  You have no choice in this, don't think about winning, think about staying alive.  I want the item, and if you don't give it to me, I'm gonna kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a panicky hiss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have it with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sent it to myself in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sent it where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A post office box. Suddenly Gregor runs forward, towards the exit.  Sam runs after him, tackling him just as they reach - THE OUTSIDE, where the two men roll into plain sight of - The Gunmen, are still covered by Vincent and Deirdre.  Now we notice That the Ancient Geezer and his Tour Group are really clo no more than ten yards away, as - Sam has Gregor pinned f first on the ancient stone of the theater.  He looks up a the others, and that's when it happens - Edvard looks at and recognizes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned, announcing to the group)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know who he is?  He's with Interpol, the Internation Police.  He's a cop. A SLOW MOTION BEAT. Vincent and Deirdre don't know what to make of this, thei heads turn to look at Sam, and in this instant - The Tour Group walks into their midst and - The 2nd Gunman reaches his piece and - Sam FIRES his gun at the 2nd Gunman, and the sharp report of the pistol we move back to REAL TIME, The Crowd panics, screaming, and now Edvard is reaching f his weapon, as - Sam shoots again, killing the 2nd Gunman and now - The Crowd is still screaming and running as - Gregor shoves through the crowd into the exit, as - Deirdre pushes through the crowd, and now she's made it i the tunnel.  Now we go -

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE THEATER -
dialogues.text: Where Larry has heard the shot -- his piece is drawn, but he's been ordered to stay in the car.  In frustration he slams on the steering wheel, as we see that - Behind Larr the Watcher is slowly closing in, knife poised to strike we go back -

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE THEATER -
dialogues.text: Edvard tries to get to the exit, but there are too many Tourists in his way, and he proceeds to shoot several of them, including the Dad we saw earlier.  Seconds later, Edvard has vanished into the tunnels, and now - Vincent a Sam meet in the middle of the crowd.  There is time for a QUICK BEAT, while Vincent glares at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a cop...you're a fucking cop...I should kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can't. And now Sam runs into the tunnel, after the others, leavi Vincent for a fraction of a second to sigh, and then foll Sam into -

dialogues.speaker: THE TUNNELS -
dialogues.text: It's like being in the tunnels and ramps of a sporting ar Except that everything here is made of stone and the only light comes from the sun which streams in through the exi openings which are spaced far enough apart that they prov just barely enough light for us to see.  Now we do a SERI OF QUICK CUTS - Sam running, followed by - Vincent, while Edvard takes a wrong turn down a dark hall and comes to a dead end.  He turns around, looking for a way out as - Gr sees the final exit ahead of him as we go - OUT IN THE STREET - Larry is still behind the wheel of th Citroen, anxiously looking at the exit, not realizing tha The Watches is almost on him, and now we're back -

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TUNNELS -
dialogues.text: Deirdre comes running around a corner, and now she's almo reached the exit as -

dialogues.speaker: OUT IN THE STREET -
dialogues.text: Gregor hits the street running.  He doesn't notice the Citroen parked ahead, because he's never seen it before, as he runs by - The car door swings open and Gregor runs straight into it He smashes into the door and falls to the ground, injured Strong Hands reach out of the car and pull him in.  It's Watcher, and let's give him a name now because he needs o SEAMUS REILLY.  Seated in the front seat is - A very dead Larry.  Seamus has cut his throat from ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gregor, with an Irish accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to live you'll do exactly as I tell you. THROUGH THE BACK WINDOW - Deirdre appears, exiting the theater and running towards the Citroen as we go back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent, gun drawn, moves warily down one of the tunnels. Outside we can hear the dim sound of an approaching siren Vincent turns a corner and - A GUN jams itself into his f It's Edvard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I know you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vienna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course...I remember.  I quite liked you, I'm sorry to have to do this. Edvard's finger tightens around the trigger, when -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Edvard is startled by the sound of Sam's voice.  Even as squeezes off the shot, Edvard turns to look at Sam, and a does so, Vincent strikes out at the gun, sending the shot awry, causing it to - RICOCHET wildly, whining around the room, until it - Rips through Sam's side, a nasty wound b not fatal, as - Edvard tries to fire another shot but it' too late, because - Vincent fires a single shot to the he that kills Edvard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deirdre has reached the Citroen.  She looks in and sees Seamus and Gregor.  Lastly she looks at the dead Larry. sighs in disgust, but otherwise doesn't react as if surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold cocking the poor son-of-a-bitch would have sufficed, Seamus, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: SCANT SECOND LATER -
dialogues.text: Larry's body hits the street as the Citroen drives off, Deirdre behind the wheel just as - Sam and Vincent run ou the theater, with Vincent helping a wounded Sam who bleed from the wound in his side.  They arrive at the street on to see - Larry, lying dead in the street, even as the Cit speeds away from them, turning the corner before they can even think to raise their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That double-crossing bitch. Sam isn't even capable of saying that much -- he just sta after the departed Citroen with a look on his face unlike we've seen in the film: "how the hell did that happen?" there's no time to ponder this because they've been joine - A COP.  He's a local guy, he directs traffic and busts drunks in the town square -- and he's scared shitless, holding his gun in both hands, trying not to tremble, as stares back at - TWO GUNS, Sam's and Vincent's, and they' both pointed at the Cop.  LONG BEAT.  In the way off dist another siren can just be heard.  Sam and Vincent glare a the Cop, who strains with all his might to control himsel but he can't because Sam and Vincent are death waiting to served.  The cop knows he has three seconds to make up hi mind.  Two.  One.  The Cop puts his gun on the ground and steps back, raising his hands in the air.  Now - Sam and Vincent stumble into the street, and are instantly almost by - A CAR speeding around the corner, its Driver oblivio to what's going on.  The car screeches to a halt, and the Driver curses loudly in French.  And then the next thing Driver knows - A Gun is in his face.  The door is yanked and the Driver is yanked out, as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town of Orange is just visible below us as the commandeered Car drives up into the hills.  Vincent is be the wheel, while the wounded Sam sits in the passenger se Gritting his teeth, Sam peels back his shirt to get a loo - THE WOUND, and it's small but bad -- the ricochet rippe small raw hole in Sam's side.  The wound bleeds, but moderately so -- no major organs or arteries have been hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That makes twice now you've saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't save your life back there. Risked it, maybe -- but I didn't save shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see it your way, I'll see it mine. You need a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know one around here?  Somebody you trust?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...I thought I'd take you to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No hospitals.  I'll fix this myself if I have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he can't believe this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fix it yourself? (a thought comes to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we even doing this?  There's no need to run, Christ... (he can't disguise his disgust)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're with Interpol -- you're a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was a cop, a real cop, I'd have busted you a long time ago.  This isn't about you, it's about the job I have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what job is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job, Vincent, a job you don't need to know about.  I can't go to the local cops -- they'd never be able to get close enough at this point.  It's me or nobody, and I've been on this job too goddamned long not to finish. BEAT.  Sam takes out his own pack of cigarettes, offers o to Vincent and takes another for himself.  They smoke for second, before Vincent speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks to me like we're all that's left of our group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We?  There is no we in my world now, Vincent, just me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't involve you, don't you understand?  I can't even guarantee you any money out of all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't about money for me, not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with great finality)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do. Sam gives Vincent a look and shakes his head in disbelief Vincent's loyalty and sense of honor is something he's ne seen before, and Sam can only smoke in silence and consid this as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PEEPHOLE slides open, and we look through it into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Gregor sits, bound and gagged in a chair, his eyes with fright.  Now - The Peephole snicks shut, and Deirdre turns to face Seamus Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we're done with this, I want to do for that one myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's the Deirdre I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's that supposed to mean, Seamus Reilly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means I was worried that all the time you spent away from the fold might have affected you.  You've been living the life of the hired gun -- the well paid hired gun, I might note.  There's no glory to it, but there are those that like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you thought that maybe I'd grown too attached to this charade I've been playing, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been known to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to me, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goading her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I did. Seamus's taunt works: Deirdre whips out her gun and puts to his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you don't know me, then, if you think I won't kill you for an insult like that! Seamus glares at Deirdre for a moment, and she glares bac him until he starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just testing, lass.  Forgive me, but I had to do it. Deirdre glares a moment more and then puts away her gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what we agreed on, Seamus: when we get home, I don't play "the girl" again. Deirdre gives Seamus a look to make sure this last point clear and we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Stolen Car parks behind a BARN, and Sam and Vincent g out.  Waiting for them is a friend of Vincent's - JEAN- PIERRE, a Frenchman in his forties, hearty, burly, friend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Jean-Pierre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, my friend. (with a look at Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't look French to me, Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Vincent's American friend, shall we see what we can do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SURGICAL IMPLEMENTS - Are laid out on a clean cloth. Scalpel, forceps, a clamp, a sponge, medical thread and needles.  We PULL BACK TO REVEAL: Sam, stretched out on t kitchen table.  Around him we see - Vincent and Jean-Pier who are wearing rubber gloves and examining Sam's wound. Jean-Pierre holds a mirror up so that Sam can see what's going on.  Sam, with his medical training, is treating himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right there, beneath the surface.  I can just make it out. Sam is in terrible pain, but necessity dictates that he f on what's going on so that he can talk Vincent through th next procedure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you won't have a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No booze...Pain's in the mind, and the mind I can control. (quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's do it. During this next sequence, we CUT BACK AND FORTH between Sam's reactions to the surgery, and the mirror itself whe he's watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douse the wound with alcohol. Vincent pours a healthy splash of rubbing alcohol onto th wound and - Sam grits his teeth as the pain explodes up h central nervous system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jean-Pierre)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that sponge and wipe away as much of the blood as you can, keep it clean so I can see. Jean-Pierre does as Sam says, wiping away the blood that keeps filling the wound.  Throughout the procedure Jean- Pierre will do this; every time the sponge is saturated h squeezes the excess blood into - A BUCKET which sits on t floor, slowly filling up with drippings from the sponge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vincent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the clamp... Vincent picks up the clamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peel back the skin and attach the clamp. Vincent attaches the clamp to Sam's wound.  It takes perh fifteen seconds, and everyone of those seconds is agonizi for Sam.  He sweats, he grits his teeth, he grunts the smallest of grunts.  But he doesn't move.  Finally Vincen done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see the bullet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Now take the forceps, and remember, Vincent, what we're doing here is routine.  I've done stuff like this at least twenty times in the field.  There are no vital organs where you're working, no major muscles or arteries -- you can't kill me.  Just make sure you've got the bullet before you try to pull it out. Vincent probes the wound with the forceps.  This takes probably thirty seconds, and it hurts even more then when clamp was attached. Several times - Vincent seems to have the bullet in his grasp, but it slips, and each time it slips - Sam makes t smallest of noises, as if to indicate the level of the pa Finally - The forceps firmly grasp the bullet, and with a single tug, Vincent extracts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding the bullet aloft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A souvenir... He tosses the bullet through the air, and we FOLLOW IT IN SLOW MOTION as it lands in - A SAUCER, which sits on the kitchen counter.  We're back in REAL TIME, as the bullet rolls around the plate for a second before coming to a ha Now - Sam breathes the hugest of sighs, and his face rela Instantly, Vincent puts a lighted cigarette in Sam's mout and he drags deeply on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vincent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you can stitch me up on you own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then if you don't mind... (he hands the cigarette back to Vincent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pass out. And that's exactly what he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent and Jean-Pierre sit on easy chairs.  An open bott of wine sits between them, a FIRE burns in the fireplace, they smoke in a contented silence for a moment.  When the speak, it is in FRENCH, with ENGLISH SUBTITLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's tough, your American friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sam's tough alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you respect him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen a man who could have taken what he just went through. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, trying to find a way to say it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly?  But close enough, eh? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he saved your life, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he hadn't you'd have put a bullet in his head a long time ago. Both men stare back into the fireplace and we HOLD FOR A before we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is awake.  Pale from the loss of blood, he moves soft around the kitchen, searching professionally for somethin giving the moment a slightly dangerous feel because he se so intent on what he's doing and then he finds it - THE COFFEE.

dialogues.speaker: TEN MINUTES LATER -
dialogues.text: A stream of Hot Coffee migles with a stream of Steamed Mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A STEAMING CUT OF COFFEE sits in Sam's hands as he lights cigarette to go with the coffee.  He sits on an ancient chair, smoking in silence, looking out at - THE WOODS aro the house, and this place is postcard-beautiful, the Fren Farmhouse you see only in pictures.  But Sam's mind is elsewhere, he's staring into space, lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're feeling better? ANOTHER ANGLE - Jean-Pierre stands in the open front door the farmhouse, with a cup of coffee.  Now, Jean-Pierre mo out to join Sam, sitting down on another chair opposite h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (responding to the question)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some, thanks.  Enough to move on, for now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at Sam's wounded side)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should really let a doctor look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first you have something to take care of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something important?  A thing that cannot wait?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It gets done now or not at all.  Another couple of days and the parties concerned are gone where I can't get them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive my intrusion into your affairs, but I am the one who connected Vincent to this job, his agent, if you will.  He is one of my oldest friends and I owe him a great debt, much like the debt I suspect he owes you.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE FARMHOUSE
dialogues.text: Where Vincent has just poured himself a cup of coffee and a very satisfying cigarette when he hears the voices from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent doesn't owe me a thing. Vincent looks up when he hears his name and he moves towa the sound of the voices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees this differently, as you well know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't expect that he would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You suffered through an agonizing pain last night, pain you could have avoided by declaring yourself an agent of the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent told you that I'm a cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a word.  But no ordinary criminal would have the extensive military and medical expertise you do.  And so I place the pieces of the puzzle together in a way that makes sense to me.  You work for some government agency and you carry a gun, and in my world, that makes you a cop. And now Jean-Pierre produces a LONG BARRELED REVOLVER whi he places loosely in his lap -- a gesture which seems to "you'd better explain things to my satifaction or we're gonna have a problem."  Sam notices the weapon, but he doesn't react overtly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is what, a test?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it a reckoning of character. BEAT.  Sam looks at the Revolver again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was healthy, I could take that away from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps.  But you are not healthy, and if you try I'll kill you. QUICK CUT TO: Vincent - Who stands inside the house, out sight, but not out of ear shot.  He's listening to everything, and we notice that Vincent has taken out his own gun. BACK ON Jean-Pierre and Sam.  By now Jean-Pierre has rais the pistol.  He doesn't point it at Sam, but his finger c the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is it you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I want to know how a man like you is created.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Created?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps forged is a better word.  Like steel.  Like a sword.  You're a modern Samurai.  I've spent my life around extraordinary men -- men like Vincent. But I've never seen anyone like you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid Vincent will die if he goes with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent's life is his own burden; he'll have to carry it for himself.  And I'm not any kind of Samurai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem one to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Samurai has honor, a Samurai live by the code of Bushido, the way of the warrior.  I'm just a killer for hire. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world isn't about honor, anymore. It's about survival. LONG BEAT.  Something in Sam's speech touches Jean-Pierre He relaxes his finger on the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Survival.  I suppose that's as good a cause as any. BACK ON Vincent - Who relaxes his grip on his gun. BACK O Sam and Jean-Pierre - And we're PULLING BACK, AWAY from t Farmhouse, which glows in the morning sun as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK COMPACT CAR sits in front of a Parisian Post Offi Inside the car, behind the wheel, we see Deirdre.  Now, coming out of the Post Office, we see - Gregor and Seamus Reilly.  Seamus has a coat slung over his arm, hiding the which he keeps pressed to Gregor's side.  There's no sign the Briefcase as Seamus and Gregor get into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK!  The door slams shut.  Gregor and Seamus are in th back seat.  Almost instantly Seamus angrily snaps a pair handcuffs on Gregor.  Immediately, Deirdre pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping all over him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problem my ass!  I think you're lying to me, and if you are you're a dead man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would somebody tell me what fucking well happened in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eager to explain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The package didn't come.  I'm sure it will tomorrow. Suddenly Seamus seems to lose it.  He grabs Gregor and sl a gun against his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's almost foaming at the mouth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're lying to me you poor excuse for a human being, I'm gonna blow your brains all over this car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beyond desperate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, it has to come here!  It has to... BEAT.  For one tension-filled moment, we think Seamus is going to splash Gregor's brains all over the place.  But he smiles, puts his weapon away, and pats Gregor gently o the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ease up, man...I'm just checking to make sure you're on the level. Gregor is beyond speech -- he can only whimper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it seems to me I saw a sign in there that says they got a late afternoon delivery.  Why don't we come back later today and do this all over again, huh? Seamus smiles a smile that is more than a little bit sadistic.  Neither Gregor nor Deirdre smiles in return as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE EIFFEL TOWER fills our eyes.  And then we PULL BACK T REVEAL that it's a tacky, flyblown poster on a dingy stre And now we're - MOVING DOWN the Street, until we come to a store whose si advertises in English - HONG KONG MOVIES.  The windows of store are filled with posters.  We MOVE THROUGH TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY SIMON, an expatriate black American, runs this place lives above it.  His shelves are lined with action films in the Far East.  Tony knows everything there is to know about the films he sells -- but he also knows quite a bit about what's going on in the Parisian Underworld.  he's a professional information broker.  Right now he's talking CUSTOMER in perfect French, with English Subtitles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, they're both great movies.  One is more of a character study, the other is more of a straight action thing, but they're great movies, and he's an amazing fucking filmmaker. Tony looks up and sees something that catches his attenti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... Vincent and Sam have entered the store.  Sam's ability to back on his feet in such a short time is amazing -- but w can see that he's not the same guy he was at the start of film.  what he does from here on in he does by sheer forc will.  Now - Tony moves to join them, and the conversatio immediately turns to English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vincent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My man, how you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alright.  And you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing well. (with a look at Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A friend.  I was telling him about how you always have the latest tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we step into my office... Tony's office, it turns out, is the area behind the COUNT Tony raises a section of the counter that allows him to g to the other side, and then he closes it behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what can I do for you? Vincent checks out the store before he starts speaking. place is empty except for - The single Customer Tony was talking to.  The Customer is still considering the two fi Tony was showing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you had any movies that were particularly new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matter of face there's this flick I've been hearing about.  I haven't seen it, but from what I hear it's pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an international thing.  Several different peoples involved, criminals from all over the world, experts brought together to do a job.  But maybe the most interesting thing about it is that preeminent in the plot we find the Russian Mob and the IRA in bed together. An unlikely group of partners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have the tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might know where you could get a copy. The Customer approaches the counter.  He has both tapes w him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vincent and Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me do some business with my boy here, and I'll meet you across the street in five.  I gotta make homes here feel like he's getting a good deal while I give him the pleasure of overpaying me for a couple of second generation pirates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Customer exits, smiling and carrying his tapes -- wha great fucking deal he just got!  A few seconds later, Ton comes out and locks up the store front.  He crosses the street towards -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUGE FALAFEL drips lettuce and tahini sauce from its en We PULL BACK ON - Tony, who's just taken a bite out of th falafel.  He sits at a table in the back with Vincent and Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his mouth full)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I've heard so far, it's all a lot of talk.  I wasn't so sure what to make of it at first, cause, like I said, the Irish and the Russians are an unlikely mix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you might know where we can get a copy of this tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All depends on whether you want the Russian or the Gaelic language version.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (instantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaelic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tony)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russian would be easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause the Russian production company would be easier to find.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Irish tape we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a sigh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna be tough. Tony scribbles something on a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last I heard there was a film rep for the Irish players staying at this address, name of Seamus Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repeating it, he knows this name)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seamus Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seamus Reilly, boy's a serious Irish Auteur -- a real firebrand.  Thinks his more moderate filmmaking brethren have turned to making movies for peace-loving pussies, if you see what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get the picture. Sam reaches for the piece of paper, but Vincent puts his on top of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony and I have to talk some business, first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta try and overcharge him, he has to moan about the price, we settle somewhere in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a matter of respect. (to Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you wait outside, this won't take long. Sam smiles slightly and rises from the table, moving towa the exit.  Behind him in rapid-fire French, Tony and Vinc are now discussing the price of the information.  They ar both loud and abusive, and obviously they're enjoying themselves immensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent exits the shop and gets into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Sam sits in the passenger seat as Vincent slides be the wheel.  Vincent tosses Sam a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Irish representative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Vincent gives Sam another piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The address of the Russian production company.  Just in case we need to find them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thorough man. Vincent starts the car and we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Peugeot sits, parked at a cub, a discreet distance fr AN APARTMENT HOUSE: 35 Rue de Glacon.  We PUSH IN on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PIECE OF PAPER scarwled with the same address: 35 de Glacon.  We PULL BACK TO REVEAL - Sam, holding this paper and looking out at the apartment complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure your friend got the right place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Tony says this is it, then it's it. BEAT.  Vincent wants to know something important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, Sam: why do you do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continue when it would be so much easier to give it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then quit. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't work for Interpol, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I do.  You heard him, you heard the guy -- that's what he said, what Edvard said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a cover, then.  A cover within a cover, a feint within a feint. (quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work for the CIA, it's the only possible answer. LONG BEAT.  Sam considers what to say, and then decides h owes Vincent the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a field agent -- last of an already extinct breed.  I do dark ops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark ops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark operations.  Wet work.  Kidnaping. Assassination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not very zen of you, huh?  Not so much the modern Samurai after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never made that claim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  Jean-Pierre did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were behind the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was waiting to see what would happen. I didn't want to kill him if I didn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would have done that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would have tried not to.  But yes, if it would have kept him from shooting you, I would have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you have done that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I owe you. (he sees something)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that... THEIR POV: Through the Windsheild - Deirdre exits the apartment building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly exultant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All things come to those who wait. Now Deirdre is followed by Seamus and Gregor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really surprised by this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not dead. BACK ON Sam and Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (figuring it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't have the package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it yourself: Gregor's not dead. If they had the package, they'd have killed him. Vincent and Sam exchange a look -- now they both figure i out. VINCENT & SAM (simultaneously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND signs a receipt, and we PULL BACK TO REVEAL Gregor a counter, signing for his package, which slides across t counter.  It's the Briefcase, although it's been wrapped BROWN PAPER for its journey through the French Postal Sys Now we see that - Seamus is still right beside Gregor; is face, almost on top of him, with a hand in his coat pocke which lets us know where his gun is.  Now - The two men s to move towards the exit as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Compact Car idles at a nearby curb, with Deirdr behind the wheel.  She's staring so intently at the front the post office, that she's surprised when a SHADOW falls across her.  She looks up to see - Sam, standing next to car.  Deirdre starts to reach for her weapon, but Sam cut her off with a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it... Something in his voice conveys enough of a threat that sh backs off.  Now she and Sam exchange a long look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it isn't Mr. Interpol himself. (she really sounds betrayed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I misjudged you like I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please..you're on some sort of holy mission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a patriate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even think that I'm buying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you get off saying word one? All the time pretending to be one of us, it's the same thing we were doing, Seamus and myself.  And here you are so high and mighty, like you're so different from the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she sees something)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bloody fucking hell... CUT AWAY TO: Gregor and Seamus are leaving the post offic By now, Seamus has taken the package away from Gregor. Unseen by these two men - Vincent is approaching from the side, on an intercept course, his hand inside a bag which carries with him.  Now - Deirdre turns and shoots Sam a l He's still watching her keenly, and we can see that she's aching to reach for her piece, but she can't because Sam still on her like a hawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even think it. He pulls back the folds of his suit jacket, revealing his gun, putting his hand comfortably on the pistol grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd kill you before you had it halfway out. Vincent is closing on Gregor and Seamus, another ten seco and he'll have them. Now - Deirdre looks back at Sam, then back at the situati developing in front of her, and then suddenly - She slams car into gear and drives off, tires squealing while - Sam pulls his piece, sighting down the barrel and - He can't it, can't shoot Deirdre.  Now - The sound of the car aler Seamus, who turns in time to see - Vincent, who is raisin the bag wrapped around his hand as - The car flies direct at - Vincent, who if forced to jump out of the way even a pulls the trigger of the gun hidden within the bag.  The of the bag explodes in a burst of fire, but the shots are the mark - Missing Seamus and Gregor as - Vincent rolls o of the way, just in time, while - Deirdre brakes the car screaming halt, as Seamus pushes Gregor in ahead of him a then gets in.  Seconds later, the car pulls out, even as Sam drives up in the Peugeot to Vincent, who picks himsel off the ground and leaps into the car.  The last thing we hear is the sound of Sam's Voice as the Peugeot drives of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your seatbelt on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During this SEQUENCE, we'll JUMP CUT BETWEEN the two cars the streets they travel through.  Now - The Black Compact flies down a small street, followed closely by - The Peug where Sam is driving as Vincent tries to steady his gun t get a clear shot at the other Car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know?  Bullshit, you had her, there was no way out.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COMPACT CAR -
dialogues.text: Where Deirdre is driving for dear life, while Seamus is freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in bloody hell is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're part of the team.  One of them's the guy I told you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Interpol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you kill her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you kill him?

dialogues.speaker: OUT IN THE STREET -
dialogues.text: The two cars SLAM through the traffic, heading for a HIGH RAMP which appears now perhaps two blocks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (figuring it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You slept with her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it these fellahs managed to get the drop on us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you: they're good...

dialogues.speaker: OUT IN THE STREET -
dialogues.text: THE TWO CARS have reached the highway ramp, and as first and then the other pulls onto the highway, we PULL BACK A

dialogues.speaker: THE PERIFERIQUE -
dialogues.text: The massive and confusing highway system which encircles city of Paris.  Right away we notice that this entrance r leads to a traffic circle, filled with various off ramps which lead to no less than four different sections of the Periferique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slamming the dashboard in disgust)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You slept with her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lecturing Deridre)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have kill him when you had the chance.  But no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put everything on the line because you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if finishing Vincent's sentence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You slept with the fucker!!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PERIFERIQUE -
dialogues.text: THE PEUGEOT cruising on an upper part of the traffic circ while down below them - THE COMPACT turns towards one of roadways. VINCENT (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left left left!!! Sam looks up and sees - Three possible ramps: one to the right, one to the center, and one to the - Left.  At the second he takes the left turn as we go back to -

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COMPACT CAR -
dialogues.text: Where Seamus has turned from lecturing Deirdre to threate Gregor.  Seamus holds the package in one hand and his gun the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving the package)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This better be the real thing or you're a dead man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is, I'm telling you it is!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've told me a lot of things, boyo... ZING-SHATTER!  A BULLET blows a hole in their back windsh as - The Peugeot is catching up, and Vincent is leaning o of his window, firing away.  Now - Seamus turns to Deirdr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lose them! Deirdre swings the wheel wildly, and the Compact takes a screaming turn, followed by - The Peugeot, and now they'r both speeding towards another junction, where several oth roadways of the Periferique run together.  Now we see tha Seamus is returning Vincent's fire, even as - The Junctio approaches, and now - Seamus screams at Deirdre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the right!!! Deirdre swerves to the right only to discover that she's on an - EXIT RAMP, going against heavy traffic.  Now - Deirdre swerves her car around, side-swiping several cars but avoiding a major crash while - The Peugeot follows al and now - One of the cars that Deirdre side-swiped careens wildly d the ramp, crashing into - The Peugeot, which grinds to a as Vincent and Sam bounce forward in their seats, restrai by their seatbelts.  The car has stalled, and Sam has to start her up again and slam it into gear before following after - The Compact, which now has a lead of perhaps fift yards -- but at least it's possible for the Peugeot to fo after the Compact, because it's the only car on the highw ahead of them that's GOING THE WRONG WAY, and now we - PU BACK, LOOKING DOWN FROM ABOVE, and the two cars are flyin through the rush-hour traffic, going the wrong way, and n The Peugeot is gaining ground as Sam turns to Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a goddamn cigarette!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fumbling with a cigarette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you driving? (rapid fire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not French, you don't live here, you don't know these roads.  Why are you driving? He puts the cigarette in Sam's mouth and as he does - The Peugeot weaves in and out of the traffic, gaining ground the Compact, and now - SCREEEEECCHHH!!!!  About fifteen c pile up, crashing into one another, and yet somehow - The Compact Car emerges from the pile up unscathed, and Seamu breathes a hugh sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing in her mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet... The Peugeot has also managed to avoid the pile-up, and it back on their tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (practically tearing his hair)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good Christ!  Can't you lose these jokers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through clenched teeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're good! And now the Peugeot SLAMS into the side of the Compact Ca and as it does - Seamus opens fire with his gun, even as Vincent unloads the better part of a clip as - Glass shat in both cars, and now Deirdre looks up to see - A FORK IN THE ROAD, and the left side of the fork is clos off, blocked by - A SERIOUS CONCRETE BARRICADE, and the Compact Car is headed right for it, and now - Sam has the Peugeot pinned right to the side of the Compa Car, metal against metal, a scream of steel as the Barric rushes straight at them and at the last second - Deirdre slams on the brakes as - Seamus fires one last shot that - blows out the window in front of Sam's eyes, causing Sam to - Jerk the wheel of t Peugeot wildly, spinning out of control onto the exit ram Gregor reaches over and unbuckles Seamus's seatbelt right The Compact Car slams into the Barricade and CRASHES, and we're in SLOW MOTION as - Deirdre is driven forward by the force of the impact, but there's a driver's side air bag, and it explodes, cushion her, even as - Seamus is hurled form the car, crashing through the windshield and flying through the air as - The Compact Car flips over and over and over while - Gregor, who is wearing his seatbelt, hangs on for dear li to the Briefcase, which he grabbed back from Seamus befor the crash, and now - Seamus hits the ground with a terrible thud, his face sliced to ribbons by the windshield, but somehow still al as - Sam tries to control the Peugeot, which is in a spin on t exit ramp as - Gregor kicks open the back door and slides out of the Car carrying the Briefcase with him, as - Deirdre struggles to free herself from the wreck, which i now - On fire, and now - Sam has managed to stop the Peugeot, but it's too late to back, because - A VERITABLE FLEET OF COP CARS is now closing on the accid and it's too late to turn around, and even as - Deirdre manages to pull herself out of the wreck, it - EXPLODES into a ball of fire, and the blast wave of fire Hits Seamus, knocking him down, covering him for a second even as - Deirdre hurls herself through the flames and co out - Rolling away with Seamus, who is now not only cut t pieces, but his face is covered with some hideous burns. Now Deirdre pulls Seamus over the side of the embankment, right before the cops arrive, and the two of them roll/fa almost thirty down a steep incline, even as - Sam catches a quick glimpse of - Gregor, scurrying away from the highway, carrying the Briefcase, and now Sam has to gun his car and get gone, because the Cops have reached - The Wreck, which is quickly burning itself out, and as th Cops look into the debris they see that - THERE'S NOBODY LEFT.  Everybody's gone. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FRONT DOOR, guarded by about five heavy locks, opens an Vincent and Sam enter.  Sam looks around and surveys the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice place. ANOTHER ANGLE - And we see the rest of the apartment: the practically nothing here.  A table with a couple of chair fridge.  An open door leads to a bedroom with a small, sp bed and a nightstand with a cheap lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (by way of explaining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not here very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Business keeps you on the road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. The two men crass the room towards - A METAL CABINET whic tucked into a nook in the wall - VINCENT'S HAND turns a h duty COMBINATION LOCK and then: Click, the cabinet opens we see -- WEAPONS.  An endless cache of guns, knives, explosives, surveillance devices, gun scopes -- you name it's here.  Now Vincent's Hands reach into the cabinet an start taking out weapons.  We PULL BACK ON - Vincent, who gives the weapons to Sam.  Sam checks to mak sure the weapons are loaded and/or ready for use, and the piles them, one on top of the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I don't need to say this to you, but I need to say it to you. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my job, I have to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't, and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If our positions were reversed, would you leave me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he says this too quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think not. BEAT.  Sam can't say anything, because he knows that what Vincent is saying is true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (considering the weapons)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we need anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  We need out fucking heads examined. Vincent thinks about this for a seoncd -- and then burst laughing as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deirdre once behind the wheel.  The passenger seat next t her is empty, but as she drives we can see her eyes as th flick from the road in front of her, to the rearview mirr which reveals - A glimpse of the HIDEOUS FACE of Seamus Reilly.  Crashing through the windshield and the blast of fire have forever changed the way he looks: his face is now a mass of oozin wounds and burn tissue.  In his eyes we see the light of sick, twisted man who's gone over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better be careful, Seamus, before something happens a plastic surgeon can't fix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hideous laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plastic fucking surgeon? (indicates his face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm going to fix this, Deirdre lass?  It's the mark of the patriot, and I'll wear it like a badge.  As for those who done it to me, I'll take my pound of flesh before this is all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking with your gun, Seamus, and not your head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!!! (he puts a gun to her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and drive!  I'm your superior officer and you will do as I goddamn well say, is that understood?!? BEAT.  Deirdre bristles at Seamus's words but says nothin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I need to repeat myself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Seamus.  I heard you the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAR zooms off into the night and as it does - A LIGHT RAIN starts to fall and we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SAME RAIN falls, more of a steady mist than a rain. mist GLEAMS electrically in the THOUSAND WATT LIGHTS whic shine from - THE CHATEAU.  Hundreds of years old, it sits back from its own MAIN GATE.  In front of the Chateau - A MEN.  Lots of them.  Whatever this place is, it's not one that invites company.  Now we're - MOVING TOWARDS the Chateau, and as we MOVE we get a glimpse of the surroundi environment: ancient statues, sitting benches in private gardens, small pools of fish -- you name it, this place h it.  We hear VOICES, and they're talking in - RUSSIAN. Heavy, thick Russian, punctuated with words like "Da!" an "Nyet!" -- making it clear that we've reached the address the Russian Production Company.  BEHIND THE CHATEAU - MOR GARDENS, more everything.  It's well-patrolled, but there aren't quite as many guards back here as there are out fr because bordering the chateau is a natural fotress -

dialogues.speaker: A WOODS -
dialogues.text: A forest, really.  Filled with ancient trees, almost myth in appearance, and for all the light of the chateau this place is darkness visible -- light comes here and dies. in this woods, looking out, we find - Vincent and Sam. Heavily armed, they've just humped God knows how many mil through the woods to get here.  Both men exhausted from t walk -- Sam from his wound, Vincent from his smoking habi They collapse and Vincent takes out his cigarettes.  Even though they're screened from the chateau back here, Sam reaches over and takes the cigarettes out of Vincent's ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here.  They might see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm going to die for the CIA, I'm going to go out smoking. (takes the cigarettes back and lights one)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, there's half a forest between us and them, they can't see a goddamned thing. Vincent offers one to Sam, who declines with a shake of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just like that... Just before I turn around and it's six months from now and the first thing I do when I wake up in the morning is light a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (obviously he does this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What of it? (almost to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samurai pain in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he hates this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you stop with that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  You've got more force of will than anyone I've ever seen.  You handle a gun like it's a part of you, you perform surgery on yourself without anesthesia... (quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And most amazing of all, you quit smoking, just like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (qith a cynical laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mark of a true Samurai. (seriously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I do for the Company, Vincent, is no different than what you do.  We're both hired guns, and this is a job -- like any other job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why then, Sam, don't you act like this is a job like any other?  Surely, if you are a hired gun, you realize that some times you just have to walk away without getting what you came for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the one thing I've got left to hold onto. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean-Pierre is one of your closest friends, is he not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closest and oldest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet you would have killed him to save my life. (quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a sense of honor, Vincent, that I can't even remember anymore.  I don't know that I ever even had it to begin with.  All I know to do, Vincent, is to finish my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you finish?  What then?  This package, whatever it is, do you give it to the CIA?  Do you really think they deserve it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a good question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a good answer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's really just considering this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARMED RUSSIAN MOBSTERS everywhere -- a convention of the squad. MOVING THROUGH the Chateau itself, and from in here we se the side of France we haven't yet seen in this film: cult Each room could be a museum, as we move through - A GALLERY, filled with paintings by Renaissance Masters - A PARLOR, with antique furniture, the youngest piece of w is two hundred years old - A BALLROOM, empty and barren, but lit by the dazzling lig of an exquisite chandelier - A KITCHEN, where a cigarette smoking CHEF is putting the finishing touches on what is perhaps the most amazing mea you've ever seen.  Now - A SERVANT takes the tray and car it out to - A DINING ROOM, and the table is set for a formal dinner f twenty, with crystal and china at every place setting, an yet the table is occupied by only one man - MIKHAEL RACHEV, Russian Gangster Supreme, called Mikhi. The Servant sets the food down in front of Mikhi, and as chief hood starts to eat a lonely and solitary dinner we BACK, MOVING DOWN the length of the way-too-long table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TAXI pulls up to the Main Gate and Gregor gets out. Attached to his wrist, by that same handcuff: the Briefca Gregor is admitted by a Guard as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikhi the Gangster is eating his dinner as Gregor is ushe into the room.  THREE THUGS hang back behind Gregor, watc to see what Mikhi wants.  Now - Mikhi waves the Thugs out of the room, leaving Gregor alo with the gangster.  Mikhi takes a last few bites of dinne he motions for Gregor to sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian, English subtitles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit, sit... (offering a cigarette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mikhi, I wouldn't. (letting that sink in for a minute)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I won't speak your language, and you can't speak mine, English will do nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (makes no never mind to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you wish... (lights his own cigarette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has all been a terrible mistake, Gregor.  I wanted to play straight with you, but Edvard insisted we try and kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edvard said the same thing about you before he died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm shocked, shocked to think that you'd believe him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly sharp)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough! Gregor raises the Briefcase which is still attached to hi wrist via the handcuff.  Gregor rests the Briefcase on th table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh... The moment of truth.  Before this scene can develop any further, a VOICE comes from Off Screen, and as the Voice speaks, Gregor blanches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment of truth, is it? ANOTHER ANGLE - Deirdre and Seamus have entered the room. And we notice something unusual: nobody is alarmed (excep for Gregor, that is).  It's as if they were expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he doing here? As Seamus speaks he walks through the room, examining the valuable china and crystal, all the while moving inexorab closer to Gregor.  His face is, if anything, even more horrific than it was a short while ago, as his formerly f wounds have started to scab over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I doing here?  Why, I'm here to see my partners, Gregor, the boys in the Russian Mafia.  See, your bosses had hoped to screw me by hiring you to pull your thieving double cross.  But they only just found out that what's in the briefcase is completely useless without me.  I can't fight them, and they can't kill me -- that means we're gonna have to do business together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you hate each other!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a little hate between business partners?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent's CIGARETTE is stubbed into a rock and the two me rise with a slow purpose.  They exchange a look and then steps forward, leading the way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on point, Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK LAWN OF THE CHATEAU -
dialogues.text: Pure Kurosawa.  The JAPANESE DRUM we've heard before star to play again as - THE LONG SHADOWS of Sam and Vincent come out of the woods into the brilliant light of the back lawn.  For one minut they stand still, and among the many weapons that Sam car is a long automatic rifle, strung over his back, and in t SILHOUETTE for one minute it looks like a Samurai sword. the two men start to move across the lawn, hugging the shadows of the various statues and hedges, trying to keep from being discovered for as long as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Seamus)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you've got it all figured, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
