dialogues.text: Figured enough to know there's an odd man out and I'm looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think not. (holds up the Briefcase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have, of course, taken the precaution of wiring the briefcase to explode five seconds after it opens.  Unless, of course, I deactivate it before it goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fucking figures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should any of you decide to rush me, I'll kill myself and whoever happens to be near me at the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And more importantly --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll destroy whatever's in the case. BEAT.  Nobody moves.  Nobody speaks.  Until finally -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks, Gentlemen, as if we're gonna have to sit down to table and work out an agreement. Before this entirely too-weird scenario can play itself w back to -

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK LAWN OF THE CHATEAU -
dialogues.text: Sam and Vincent are closer to the Chateau, moving in stea avoiding any entanglements and then Sam turns a corner an comes face to face with - A GUARD, and his gun is aimed a Sam's head: Sam's a dead man as we go -

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO THE DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: AUTOMATIC WEAPONS FIRE splits the night, and everyone in room looks at one another, before Mikhi speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: BACK OUTSIDE THE CHATEAU -
dialogues.text: The Guard who had Sam in his sights falls down, dead, sho - Vincent, whose smoking weapon is cradled in his arms. Vincent smiles at Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one less I owe you... Sam smiles, but it's no time to get satisfied.  their presence revealed, there's no point in moving quietly.  S draws his weapons and as he and Vincent charge across the lawn towards the Chateau while -

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE DINING ROOM -
dialogues.text: MORE GUNSHOTS from outside -- not a war, but enough to ca serious alarm.  Deirdre, ever the soldier, draws her two automatic pistols.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Seamus and Mikhi)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two stay here and watch our mutual interest. She nods at Gregor and his Briefcase, indicating what thi mutual interest is.  Then she turns and bolts the room, a as she does we're -

dialogues.speaker: BACK OUTSIDE THE CHATEAU -
dialogues.text: Sam and Vincent are running along, hugging the ground and whatever darkness they can find, while blind weapons fire rips into the ground around them, Russian thugs not even what they're shooting at, but shooting all the same as Sa and Vincent hurtle towards -

dialogues.speaker: A BACK ENTRANCE TO THE CHATEAU -
dialogues.text: Some kind of kitchen storage area, and as Sam and Vincent burst in from outside - FIVE RUSSIAN HOODS come flying in from an interior entrance, and this is it, Sam and Vincen are outnumbered, outgunned, they're going to die and then They take out the entire room - Sam holds an automatic pi in his left hand, and a submachine gun in his right, and he fires, he does so in short controlled bursts, firing o when he has the target in his sights, while - Vincent fig with a kind of sheer force, a shotgun in one hand, an Uzi the other, he fires at anything and everything that moves and he hits almost all of it - And suddenly the room is quiet.  Everybody's dead except for Sam and Vincent.  The drop their spent weapons and take out fresh ones even as move towards - THE DOOR - It leads to two passages, each leading to a separate wing of the chateau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's work our way through the building. I'll take one wing, you take the other. Vincent and Sam split up, moving into separate WINGS of t Chateau, and as they move off Sam speaks a word of warnin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your back, Vincent. And then they're gone, and we're with - Deirdre, who's running through the house, going from room room, and we're with her for a minute, the JAPANESE DRUM starts to play again, and now it's joined by more and mor drums, and they continue for the test of this sequence an suddenly - A HUGE BURST OF GUNFIRE is heard, dragging Deirdre's attention towards -

dialogues.speaker: THE BALLROOM -
dialogues.text: And Sam's in the middle of a pitched battle with three Gunmen.  He kills the first, and then the second, and the No third.  The Third Gunman rolls out of the way as Sam fires, the Third Gunman fires back and - Their shots go w ripping into mirrors and chandeliers, littering the floor with glass.  And now we're -

dialogues.speaker: ON DEIRDRE -
dialogues.text: Running through the halls as we hear one last burst of gunfire: somebody in the ballroom is dead.  Deirdre has almost reached the ballroom when - Sam comes flying out, the two of them CRASH TOGETHER, sending the two of them sprawling into - The shot-up mess that used to be the Ballroom - And as they crash to the ground, Sam loses his weapon in the fall, but Deirdre manages to hold onto one her two guns.  Now the two of them roll to their feet, an they do we're back in -

dialogues.speaker: THE DINING ROOM -
dialogues.text: Seamus the Madman is pacing the floor, his face even wors than before: with each minute the mask of flesh that is n his face is becoming more grotesque.  Little pustules hav started to form all over its surface, oozing a whitish viscous liquid.  A NEW BURST OF FIGHTING SOUNDS can be he and Seamus, who is no longer capable of thinking straight loses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't take it anymore. (to Mikhi)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch him, man, I'm going out and finish what needs finishing! And Seamus is gone, and so are we -- back to -

dialogues.speaker: THE BALLROOM -
dialogues.text: Where Deirdre has her two guns pointed at Sam and - Does BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, them... But Deirdre can't do it.  There's something between these two, and now - Sam looks around and sees Deirdre's other pistol lying on a broken chair, and now he - Kicks out with his foot and hits the chair leg, causing i function as a lever, sending the gun - THROUGH THE AIR in graceful SLOW-MO arc until it - THWACKS into Sam's Hand. he's armed and he looks back at - Deirdre.  Her FINGER tightens on the trigger, she's almost ready to shoot -- i Sam raises his piece, he's a dead man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go, Sam, walk away. In response Sam stares at Deirdre for a BEAT and then he smiles an enigmatic smile and - He steps sideways, into a nearby corridor, vanishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it! She runs after him but she's too late -- The corridor out is empty.  Now we're back in -

dialogues.speaker: THE DINING ROOM -
dialogues.text: With Gregor and Mikhi, and the tension is unbearable, bec they can hear the sounds of the fighting as it starts and then stops, but they don't have the least idea of what's going on.  Still, Mikhi won't let Gregor leave without gi up the Briefcase.  Mikhi has a gun on Gregor, who in turn holds the Briefcase close, ready to open it and set off t Second Timer that will blow it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a feral hiss)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll die if we stay here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threatening with the gun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll die if you leave here. Gregor sits back down, fairly close to Mikhi.  Then, in a manner so deft that Mikhi never even notices, Gregor extr a wickedly thin stiletto blade from the leather lining of Briefcase.  Before Mikhi can even react, Gregor stabs his forward in a savage arc - JAMMING THE BLADE into Mikhi's throat.  Mikhi drops his gun and reaches for the blade, already gagging on the blood spray which shoots from the slashed artery.  Within seconds - Mikhi falls to the grou jerking viciously in his death throes as - Gregor picks u the pistol and runs to leave the room, and as he does we to -

dialogues.speaker: THE GALLERY -
dialogues.text: Filled with Paintings and Sculptures, nothing less than 2 years old.  This place is a maze, what with it's walls of paintings that jut out here and there, the various corrid which lead from room to room, and the sculptures which bl sight lines.  Now we find - Vincent, pressed against a wa gun in each hand, while - FIVE RUSSIAN MAFIA GUYS are hun him down.  We do a SERIES OF QUICK CUTS as the Five Guys up and look for Vincent, all the while speaking in low Ru voices.  Suddenly one of the Guys turns a corner and sees Nothing.  No Vincent.  Now he turns back and - A FIST CRA through a painting which hangs on a makeshift wall.  It's Vincent.  His hand wraps around Mafia Guy's neck, pinning in place.  Seconds later - Two quick shots rip through th painting, hitting Mafia Guy in the head.  Now - The other are alerted by the shots, they come running and - Vincent out firing - And now it's a bullet-fest, as he gets the drop on them, using the maze of the Gallery to his fullest advantage, gunning them down - First one - Then two - Three, and the No four.  Vincent turns, surprised that his man wasn't wh he expected him to be when - A SHOT RINGS OUT, hitting Vincent, a flesh wound that disarms him.  The Last Guy ha the drop on Vincent.  Now - The Last Guy smiles a nasty little smile at Vincent and - A PISTOL spits fire and - A BULLET bursts out of the Last Guy's chest.  It's Sam.  No Sam and Vincent exchange a look: Sam has, once again, sav Vincent's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to stop doing that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll work on it... The two men don't have time for any more words, they move from the Gallery and find themselves in -

dialogues.speaker: THE DINING ROOM -
dialogues.text: Where they find nothing but the bloody remains of Mikhi t Gangster.  Sam and Vincent are surveying the room when a VOICE comes from BEHIND them -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around real slow, and try hard not to breathe when you do it. ANOTHER ANGLE - Seamus Reilly has come in behind them, an he's got his gun pointed straight at Sam's heart.  If Sea is enraged at discovering Gregor's absence, he's overjoye find Sam in his place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you... (touches his face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one did this to my face, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice afterlife. Seamus pulls the trigger and his BULLET spins out towards Sam, ready to blow a hole through him except that - Vince leaps forward and takes the bullet -- it rips into his si a huge splash of red against his white shirt.  He falls t the ground, horribly wounded, but he's given Sam enough t and now - Sam and Seamus open fire on one another - BULLE RIPPING into the table, chewing up the china and crystal, taking glass shattering bites out of the CHANDELIER above table, turning the Dining Room from a primo Louis XIV showpiece into shit as the two men move about and then suddenly - They're face to face, each with a gun to the o - Mexican Standoff.  Suddenly, from Off Screen -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seamus! ANOTHER ANGLE - Deirdre has appeared, her gun leveled at two men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deirdre, do for him, woman, put a fucking bullet in his head! Deirdre hesitates, uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, for Christ's sake, do it so we can find that stinking Gregor, he's got the bloody package!  For God's sake, you're a soldier... These last words sink into Deirdre: she is a soldier.  He gun swivels towards Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sensing he's getting to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one of us...You been born and bred with your own people, you can't go against your nature.  C'mon, girl, I'm you're people. Deirdre makes up her mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no girl, Seamus... She fires a shot - Blowing Seamus off his feet and throug huge PLATE GLASS WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you ain't nobody's people. She moves with Sam to Vincent, who is seriously wounded - perhaps life-threateningly so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Deirdre)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get him out of here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish the job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a commanding whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish it! Sam considers, but before he can make up his mind, Deirdr sees something through the wreck of the Dining Room Windo OUT ON THE BACK LAWN - We've already seen that it's borde on one side by the woods, for the first time we notice - LAKE, which laps against a PRIVATE DOCK, where a row boat tethered.  Now - BENEATH A VERY FULL MOON, the stark figu of Gregor makes its way toward the Dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam... Sam turns at the sound of her voice and sees Gregor makin his escape.  Sam looks back at Vincent, who is almost pas out from blood loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sick of you saving my life.  Go out and get the bastard. Same makes up his mind, and as Vincent passes out, Sam ru out after Deirdre and towards -

dialogues.speaker: THE PRIVATE DOCK -
dialogues.text: And as the two of them run we MOVE WITH THEM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got the briefcase rigged to explode five seconds after anybody other than himself tries to open it. And now they reach the Dock and they find - Nothing -- no Gregor.  And the Boat is still there.  Before Sam can restrain her - Deirdre stps out towards the Boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deirdre, wait up -- But it's too late: Gregor steps out from behind - A BOATHOUSE, and before Deirdre can even figure out what happened, Gregor has her in an arm lock, a gun to her hea His free hand sticks out and we see the Briefcase, which still handcuffed to his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might have made a good field agent you arrogant American prick, but you're not smart enough to go up against me. Gregor and Deirdre are poised at the edge of the lake.  T Private Dock is made completely of stone, and the drop to water is nearly five feet.  Sam has reached a position wh there is no right answer.  Still, he points his gun at Gregor, who in turn shields himself with Deirdre's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, shoot... Shoot and kill the bitch, I don't care. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet you don't shoot.  Interesting. Put down your weapon and walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll kill me anway, Sam, shoot though me and kill this fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a horrible croak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't, I will... ANOTHER ANGLE - Seamus is somehow still barely alive -- h not long for this world, but the will for revenge has dri him this far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sam, in a cold pale rage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot that traitorous bitch and I'll let you live. THE TOP OF SEAMUS'S HEAD explodes, finishing him off once for all, killed by - Vincent, who has staggered out to make this one necessary shot.  But he can go no further, and he collapses in his blood, near death, just as - Gregor takes a step towards boat and - Sam makes up his mind and shoots - THE BULLET

dialogues.speaker: FLIES ACROSS THE SCREEN -
dialogues.text: IMPACT - The Briefcase bursts, shot open by Sam and now w in SLOW MOTION as - Gregor relaxes his grip on Deirdre as he struggles to clo the case and - Deirdre takes the opportunity to dive the other, into the lake, while - BABOOM!  The case EXPLODES, a flash of phosphorescent whi light that incinerates Gregor and the case and whatever w inside it with an explosion that knocks Sam to the ground when the light clears - Gregor and the case are gone, whi THE EXPLOSION ECHOES out over the lake, booming again and again until finally there is - SILENCE.  Sam looks out ov the lake for any sign of Deirdre - But there is none.  An then, after we've held for a BEAT longer than it should b possible for her to have survived - her head splits the surface and she emerges, coughing.  Sam reaches down to h her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright?  It's bloody fucking freezing in here! Sam pulls Deirdre out of the water and then the two of th immediately turn and move towards Vincent, and as they do start to PULL BACK on them, and now the SOUNDS of SIRENS be heard, one, then two more, and then a symphony of nois And we're STILL PULLING BACK ON - THE CHATEAU - Or what's left of it, because it's started burn, and quickly the flames start to rise into the night like something out of medieval times as we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam waits outside a hospital room, inside of which we get glimpse of - A DOCTOR tending to a heavily bandaged and sedated Vincent.  As Sam waits - TWO GENDARMES and a PLAINCLOTHES DETECTIVE approach.  The Detective looks at for a BEAT, and then goes to push past him.  Sam blocks h way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak with that man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I can't allow that. Sam reaches into his coat, and for a moment everybody thi he's going for his gun, but instead he comes out with - A PIECE OF PAPER.  He hands it to the Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call that number and ask them what you should do. The Detective eyeballs the number suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: FIVE MINUTES LATER -
dialogues.text: The Detective hangs up a nearby wall phone and then looks over at Sam in disgust.  Without another word, the Detect signals to the two Gendarmes, and all three men exit.  No The DOCTOR, a beautiful French Woman, comes up and speaks him in FRENCH -- and the amazing thing is that Sam speaks back.  Everything in SUBTITLED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can see your friend, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The field dressing you put on saved his life. (giving him a look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where di you learn to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here and there, I guess. The Doctor isn't entirely satisfied with this answer, but it's the only one she's going to get, because Sam moves p into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's barely alive -- but alive nonetheless.  And he's hea Sam speak in French to the Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son-of-a-bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in mock exasperation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... He lies back on his pillow, pissed and yet amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repeating the Doctor's words in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Your field dressing saved his life." That's three I owe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't owe me a goddamned thing, Vincent, and you know it.  You stepped in front of a bullet for me. (very seriously, he now believes this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I owe you a heavy debt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relishing this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising to leave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get some sleep, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something first. (a quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The package: what was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Nobody knows, except a bunch of people who are too dead to tell us.  There's probably a couple of guys back at the Company who know, but I don't think they plan to tell me anytime soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone.  Destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, then a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's for the best. Sam turns for the door but Vincent has one last thing to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, when Gregor had Deirdre by the lake, you could have killed the two of them with one shot.  You could have had the package, finished the job.  But you didn't, you sacrificed the job to save her life.  Why? Same has to think about this for a second, and his answer reveals just how full circle he's come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what you would have done. And on that note Sam exits the room, leaving a bemused Vincent behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WISPY FOG atmospherically rises off the river -- not to thick, not too thin. A TITLE: One month later... We're MOVING along the cobble-stone walk next to the rive a VOICE cuts through the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you just smoke already... A RIVERSIDE CAFE - Where Sam, Vincent and Deirdre are hav morning coffee.  A mostly-healed Vincent is smoking a cigarette, trying to get Sam to light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to keep me company, Sam -- I hate smoking alone. (turning to Deirdre)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you?  I thought all you IRA types smoked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the stupid ones.  Cigarettes kill more patriots than bullets. (a quick beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I'm not IRA no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where do you go from here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I was thinking...Maybe the three of us might partner up -- guns for hire, that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm up for that... The two of them turn to Sam, but he shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me.  You work too often with the same people and you become friends -- clouds your judgement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come off it, Sam -- if we weren't friends already we wouldn't be here now, would we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's got a point. (playing a trump card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, I know of a job that's available. Sam can't help it -- he's interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much does it pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SILENCE AND FOG.  A RIVER FERRY does a slow ghostly glide down the river, and in seconds it approaches - THE RIVERSIDE CAFE, which appears through the mist, looke by -- A SLEEK PAIR OF SUN GLASSES attached to a young PUNK in a leather coat, and the Punk is looking at - Sam, Vincent, especially: Deirdre.  Sam looks up and shouts a warning a The Punk pulls a shotgun from beneath his leather coat, p the gun and screams out at Deirdre with an Irish accent -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for Seamus! BOOM!  The Punk pulls the trigger, a blast of fire as - S gun is already out, TWO QUICK SHOTS squeezed off and - Th Punk is capped twice in the head, dead, sailing away on t Ferry which never stops as - THE CAFE goes wild, CUSTOMERS running, screaming, WAITERS dropping their trays.  But - Sam doesn't run, and neither does Vincent.  Sam stands, stunned by what he sees - Deir lies on the ground, hit full on in the chest: she's dead. BEAT OF PURE SILENCE - Broken by SIRENS in the distance, quickly growing closer.  Now - Vincent looks at Deirdre's corpse, then at Sam, who is unable to move.  For maybe th first time in his professional career, Sam is staggered b the loss of a life.  Vincent gently takes Sam's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft yet urgent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go, Sam, we can't be here. Sam looks at Vincent, and for a moment Sam struggles to f something to say, but he can't find a goddamned thing.  T SIRENS are getting louder -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little louder, bordering desperation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!! Vincent literally drags Sam away and now the SIRENS have arrived, followed quickly by - THE GENDARMES, who come running into the Cafe but - It's empty except for Deirdre body.  Now -

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET ABOVE THE RIVER -
dialogues.text: Sam and Vincent are running through patchy fog, Vincent leading the way, and now - We're CLOSER ON Vincent as he runs and runs and runs unti feels he's far enough away from the scene of the crime to relax.  He collapses against a stone wall, chest heaving, shaking out two cigarettes, one for himself and one for S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrusting the cigarettes out to Sam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor's orders... But Sam isn't there to take the cigarette -- Vincent look around, trying to see what happened to his friend, but th fog has covered any sign of Sam.  Vincent stands there, stunned, alone, the cigarettes in an outstretched hand th slowly falls back to Vincent's side as he realizes that S has left him on purpose.  Then - Vincent lights both cigarettes at the saem time and throws one of them over t stone wall - THE GLOWING CIGARETTE arcs through the air u it lands in the river where it extinguishes with a hiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Sam...

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE CAFE -
dialogues.text: The Gendarmes have secured the scene (there isn't much to secure since everyone has run away).  A majority of cops surround Deirdre's dead body, but - One GENDARME wanders around the cafe, looking about, and then he sees somethin

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET ABOVE -
dialogues.text: A SHAPE IN THE FOG.  The wind blows and the fog clears fo second, and we see that it's - Sam.  Getting one last loo Deirdre.  Quickly - The Gendarme points Sam out but as he does the wind continues to blow and - THE FOG swallows Sa Seconds later the fog clears again, and when it does - Sa gone. FADE OUT.
